title: Numbers 1:1
content: 1 Then Yahweh spoke to Moses in the tent of meeting in the wilderness of Sinai on one of the second month in the second year of their going out from the land of Egypt, saying,

title: Numbers 1:2
content: 2 “Lift up the heads of all the congregation of the sons of Israel, according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, every male according to their skulls,

title: Numbers 1:3
content: 3 from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war in Israel. You and Aaron shall count them according to their armies.

title: Numbers 1:4
content: 4 And with you will be a man, a man of the tribe. He {will be} the head man of the house of his fathers.

title: Numbers 1:5
content: 5 And these {are} the names of the men who will stand with you: of Reuben, Elizur the son of Shedeur,

title: Numbers 1:6
content: 6 of Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai;

title: Numbers 1:7
content: 7 of Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab;

title: Numbers 1:8
content: 8 of Issachar, Nethanel the son of Zuar;

title: Numbers 1:9
content: 9 of Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon;

title: Numbers 1:10
content: 10 of the sons of Joseph: of Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud; of Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur;

title: Numbers 1:11
content: 11 of Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni;

title: Numbers 1:12
content: 12 of Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai;

title: Numbers 1:13
content: 13 of Asher, Pagiel the son of Okran;

title: Numbers 1:14
content: 14 of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Deuel;

title: Numbers 1:15
content: 15 of Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.”

title: Numbers 1:16
content: 16 These {were} the called ones of the congregation, the leaders of the tribes of their fathers. They {were} the heads of the thousands of Israel.

title: Numbers 1:17
content: 17 And Moses and Aaron took these men, who were designated by names.

title: Numbers 1:18
content: 18 And they assembled all the congregation on one of the second month. And they recorded their ancestry in accordance with their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, according to their skulls,

title: Numbers 1:19
content: 19 just as Yahweh had commanded Moses. And he counted them in the wilderness of Sinai.

title: Numbers 1:20
content: 20 And the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, according to their skulls, every male from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:21
content: 21 their counted ones of the tribe of Reuben {were} 46, 500.

title: Numbers 1:22
content: 22 Of the sons of Simeon, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, his counted ones by the number of the names, according to their skulls, every male from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:23
content: 23 their counted ones of the tribe of Simeon {were} 59, 300.

title: Numbers 1:24
content: 24 Of the sons of Gad, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:25
content: 25 their counted ones of the tribe of Gad {were} 45, 650.

title: Numbers 1:26
content: 26 Of the sons of Judah, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:27
content: 27 their counted ones of the tribe of Judah {were} 74, 600.

title: Numbers 1:28
content: 28 Of the sons of Issachar, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:29
content: 29 their counted ones of the tribe of Issachar {were} 54, 400.

title: Numbers 1:30
content: 30 Of the sons of Zebulun, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:31
content: 31 their counted ones of the tribe of Zebulun {were} 57, 400.

title: Numbers 1:32
content: 32 Of the sons of Joseph: of the sons of Ephraim, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:33
content: 33 their counted ones of the tribe of Ephraim {were} 40, 500.

title: Numbers 1:34
content: 34 Of the sons of Manasseh, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:35
content: 35 their counted ones of the tribe of Manasseh {were} 32, 200.

title: Numbers 1:36
content: 36 Of the sons of Benjamin, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:37
content: 37 their counted ones of the tribe of Benjamin {were} 35, 400.

title: Numbers 1:38
content: 38 Of the sons of Dan, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:39
content: 39 their counted ones of the tribe of Dan {were} 62, 700.

title: Numbers 1:40
content: 40 Of the sons of Asher, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:41
content: 41 their counted ones of the tribe of Asher {were} 41, 500.

title: Numbers 1:42
content: 42 Of the sons of Naphtali, their generations according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers, by the number of the names, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war,

title: Numbers 1:43
content: 43 their counted ones of the tribe of Naphtali {were} 53, 400.

title: Numbers 1:44
content: 44 These {were} the counted ones, whom Moses and Aaron had counted, and the leaders of Israel, 12 men, they were one man for the house of his fathers.

title: Numbers 1:45
content: 45 And they were all the counted ones of the sons of Israel according to the house of their fathers, from a son of 20 years and upward, every one who goes out to war in Israel.

title: Numbers 1:46
content: 46 And all the counted ones {were} 603, 550.

title: Numbers 1:47
content: 47 And the Levites according to the tribe of their fathers were not counted in the midst of them.

title: Numbers 1:48
content: 48 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 1:49
content: 49 “Only the tribe of Levi you shall not count, and you shall not lift up their heads in the midst of the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 1:50
content: 50 And you, appoint the Levites over the Dwelling of the Testimony and over all its vessels and over all that belongs to it. They themselves shall carry the Dwelling and all its vessels, and they themselves shall serve it, and they shall camp around the dwelling.

title: Numbers 1:51
content: 51 And when the Dwelling sets out, the Levites shall take it down, and when the Dwelling camps, the Levites shall raise it up. And the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

title: Numbers 1:52
content: 52 And the sons of Israel shall camp, a man at his camp and a man at his banner, according to their armies.

title: Numbers 1:53
content: 53 And the Levites shall camp around the Dwelling of the Testimony, and wrath will not be on the congregation of the sons of Israel. And the Levites shall keep the keeping of the Dwelling of the Testimony.”

title: Numbers 1:54
content: 54 And the sons of Israel did according to all that Yahweh commanded Moses, so they did.

title: Numbers 2:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 2:2
content: 2 “The sons of Israel will camp, a man at his banner, with the sign of the house of their fathers. They will camp away from the front, around the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 2:3
content: 3 And the ones camping to the east, to the sunrise, {will be} the banner of the camp of Judah according to their armies, and the leader of the sons of Judah {is} Nahshon the son of Amminadab,

title: Numbers 2:4
content: 4 and his army and their counted ones {are} 74, 600.

title: Numbers 2:5
content: 5 And the ones camping beside him {are} the tribe of Issachar, and the leader of the sons of Issachar {is} Nethanel the son of Zuar,

title: Numbers 2:6
content: 6 and his army and his counted ones {are} 54, 400.

title: Numbers 2:7
content: 7 The tribe of Zebulun: and the leader of the sons of Zebulun {is} Eliab the son of Helon,

title: Numbers 2:8
content: 8 and his army and his counted ones {are} 57, 400.

title: Numbers 2:9
content: 9 All the counted ones of the camp of Judah {are} 186, 400 according to their armies. They will set out first.

title: Numbers 2:10
content: 10 The banner of the camp of Reuben {will be} to the south according to their armies, and the leader of the sons of Reuben {is} Elizur the son of Shedeur,

title: Numbers 2:11
content: 11 and his army and his counted ones {are} 46, 500.

title: Numbers 2:12
content: 12 And the ones camping beside him {will be} the tribe of Simeon, and the leader of the sons of Simeon {is} Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai,

title: Numbers 2:13
content: 13 and his army and their counted ones {are} 59, 300.

title: Numbers 2:14
content: 14 And the tribe of Gad: and the leader of the sons of Gad {is} Eliasaph the son of Reuel,

title: Numbers 2:15
content: 15 and his army and their counted ones {are} 45, 650.

title: Numbers 2:16
content: 16 All the counted ones of the camp of Reuben {are} 151, 450 according to their armies. And they will set out second.

title: Numbers 2:17
content: 17 And the tent of meeting will set out {with} the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camps. As they came so will they set out, a man on his hand, according to their banners.

title: Numbers 2:18
content: 18 The banner of the camp of Ephraim according to their armies {will be} to the west, and the leader of the sons of Ephraim {is} Elishama the son of Ammihud,

title: Numbers 2:19
content: 19 and his army and their counted ones {are} 40, 500.

title: Numbers 2:20
content: 20 And beside him {is} the tribe of Manasseh, and the leader of the sons of Manasseh {is} Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur,

title: Numbers 2:21
content: 21 and his army and their counted ones {are} 32, 200.

title: Numbers 2:22
content: 22 And the tribe of Benjamin: and the leader of the sons of Benjamin {is} Abidan the son of Gideoni,

title: Numbers 2:23
content: 23 and his army and their counted ones {are} 35, 400.

title: Numbers 2:24
content: 24 All the counted ones of the camp of Ephraim {are} 108,100 according to their armies. And they will set out third.

title: Numbers 2:25
content: 25 The banner of the camp of Dan {will be} to the north according to their armies, and the leader of the sons of Dan {is} Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai,

title: Numbers 2:26
content: 26 and his army and their counted ones {are} 62, 700.

title: Numbers 2:27
content: 27 And the ones camping beside him {will be} the tribe of Asher, and the leader of the sons of Asher {is} Pagiel the son of Okran,

title: Numbers 2:28
content: 28 and his army and their counted ones {are} 41, 500.

title: Numbers 2:29
content: 29 And the tribe of Naphtali: and the leader of the sons of Naphtali {is} Ahira the son of Enan,

title: Numbers 2:30
content: 30 and his army and their counted ones {are} 53, 400.

title: Numbers 2:31
content: 31 All the counted ones of the camp of Dan {are} 157, 600. They will set out last, according to their banners.”

title: Numbers 2:32
content: 32 These {are} the counted ones of the sons of Israel according to the house of their fathers. All the counted ones of the camps according to their armies {are} 603, 550.

title: Numbers 2:33
content: 33 And they did not count the Levites in the midst of the sons of Israel, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 2:34
content: 34 And the sons of Israel did according to all that Yahweh commanded Moses. So they camped according to their banners, and so they set out, a man according to his clans, in accordance with the house of his fathers.

title: Numbers 3:1
content: 1 And these {are} the generations of Aaron and Moses in the day Yahweh spoke with Moses on the mountain of Sinai.

title: Numbers 3:2
content: 2 And these {are} the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

title: Numbers 3:3
content: 3 These {are} the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests, the ones who were anointed, whose hand he filled to serve as priest.

title: Numbers 3:4
content: 4 And Nadab died and Abihu before the face of Yahweh when they offered unfamiliar fire before the face of Yahweh in the wilderness of Sinai, and sons were not belonging to them. And Eleazar served as priest and Ithamar with the face of Aaron their father.

title: Numbers 3:5
content: 5 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 3:6
content: 6 “Bring near the tribe of Levi and stand it before the face of Aaron the priest. And they shall serve him.

title: Numbers 3:7
content: 7 And they shall keep his keeping and the keeping of all the congregation before the face of the tent of meeting, to serve the service of the Dwelling.

title: Numbers 3:8
content: 8 And they shall keep all the vessels of the tent of meeting and the keeping of the sons of Israel, to serve the service of the Dwelling.

title: Numbers 3:9
content: 9 And you shall give the Levites to Aaron and to his sons. They are given, given to him from with the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 3:10
content: 10 And you shall appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall keep their priesthood. And the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.”

title: Numbers 3:11
content: 11 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 3:12
content: 12 “And I, behold, I have taken the Levites from the midst of the sons of Israel instead of every firstborn, the opener of the womb from the sons of Israel, and the Levites are for me,

title: Numbers 3:13
content: 13 for every firstborn belongs to me. In the day of my striking down every firstborn in the land of Egypt, I set apart for me every firstborn in Israel, from human up to livestock. They are for me. I am Yahweh.”

title: Numbers 3:14
content: 14 And Yahweh spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,

title: Numbers 3:15
content: 15 “Count the sons of Levi according to the house of their fathers, according to their clans. You shall count them, every male from a son of a month and upward.”

title: Numbers 3:16
content: 16 And Moses counted them in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh, just as he was commanded.

title: Numbers 3:17
content: 17 And these were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon and Kohath and Merari.

title: Numbers 3:18
content: 18 And these {are} the names of the sons of Gershon according to their clans: Libni and Shimei.

title: Numbers 3:19
content: 19 And the sons of Kohath according to their clans {were} Amram and Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

title: Numbers 3:20
content: 20 And the sons of Merari according to their clans {were} Mahli and Mushi. These {are} they, the clans of the Levites according to the house of their fathers.

title: Numbers 3:21
content: 21 Of Gershon {were} the clan of the Libnite and the clan of the Shimeite. These {are} they, the clans of the Gershonite.

title: Numbers 3:22
content: 22 Their counted ones by the number of every male from a son of a month and upward, their counted ones {were} 7, 500.

title: Numbers 3:23
content: 23 The clans of the Gershonite were to camp behind the Dwelling, to the west.

title: Numbers 3:24
content: 24 And the leader of the house of the father of the Gershonite {was} Eliasaph the son of Lael.

title: Numbers 3:25
content: 25 And the keeping of the sons of Gershon in the tent of meeting {was} the Dwelling and the tent, its covering and the curtain of the opening of the tent of meeting

title: Numbers 3:26
content: 26 and the hangings of the courtyard and the curtains of the opening of the courtyard that {is} beside the Dwelling and beside the altar all around, and its ropes for all its service.

title: Numbers 3:27
content: 27 And of Kohath {were} the clan of the Amramite and the clan of the Izharite and the clan of the Hebronite and the clan of the Uzzielite. These {are} they, the clans of the Kohathite.

title: Numbers 3:28
content: 28 By the number of every male from a son of a month and upward, 8, 600 {were} the keepers of the keeping of the holy place.

title: Numbers 3:29
content: 29 The clans of the sons of Kohath were to camp on the side of the Dwelling to the south.

title: Numbers 3:30
content: 30 And the leader of the house of the father of the clans of the Kohathite {was} Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.

title: Numbers 3:31
content: 31 And their keeping {was} the box and the table and the lampstand and the altar and the vessels of the holy place with which they serve and the covering, and all its service.

title: Numbers 3:32
content: 32 And the leader of the leaders of the Levites {was} Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, the oversight of the keepers of the keeping of the holy place.

title: Numbers 3:33
content: 33 Of Merari {were} the clan of the Mahlite and the clan of the Mushite. These {are} they, the clans of Merari.

title: Numbers 3:34
content: 34 And their counted ones by the number of every male from a son of a month and upward {were} 6, 200.

title: Numbers 3:35
content: 35 And the leader of the house of the father of the clans of Merari {was} Zuriel the son of Abihail. They were to camp on the side of the Dwelling to the north.

title: Numbers 3:36
content: 36 And the oversight of the keeping of the sons of Merari {was} the frames of the Dwelling and its crossbars and its pillars and its bases and all its implements, and all its service,

title: Numbers 3:37
content: 37 and the pillars of the courtyard all around and their bases and their pegs and their ropes.

title: Numbers 3:38
content: 38 And the ones camping before the face of the Dwelling to the east, before the face of the tent of meeting toward the sunrise, {were to be} Moses and Aaron and his sons, the keepers of the keeping of the holy place, according to the keeping of the sons of Israel. And the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

title: Numbers 3:39
content: 39 All the counted ones of the Levites whom Moses and Aaron counted in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh, according to their clans, every male from a son of a month and upward, {were} 22, 000.

title: Numbers 3:40
content: 40 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Count every firstborn male of the sons of Israel from a son of a month and upward. And lift up the number of their names.

title: Numbers 3:41
content: 41 And you shall take the Levites for me—I {am} Yahweh—instead of all the firstborn of the sons of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the livestock of the sons of Israel.”

title: Numbers 3:42
content: 42 And Moses counted all the firstborn of the sons of Israel, just as Yahweh had commanded him.

title: Numbers 3:43
content: 43 And it happened that every firstborn male by the number of the names from a son of a month and upward, according to their counted ones, {was} 22, 273.

title: Numbers 3:44
content: 44 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 3:45
content: 45 “Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the sons of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of their livestock. And the Levites shall belong to me—I {am} Yahweh.

title: Numbers 3:46
content: 46 And the ransoms of the 273, the ones in excess over the Levites from the firstborn of the sons of Israel,

title: Numbers 3:47
content: 47 and you shall take five, five shekels for the skull. You shall take by the shekel of the holy place (20 gerahs {is} the shekel).

title: Numbers 3:48
content: 48 And you shall give the silver to Aaron and to his sons, the ransom of the ones in excess among them.”

title: Numbers 3:49
content: 49 And Moses took the silver of the ransom from with the ones in excess over the ransomed ones of the Levites.

title: Numbers 3:50
content: 50 From with the firstborn of the sons of Israel he took the silver: 1, 365 by the shekel of the holy place.

title: Numbers 3:51
content: 51 And Moses gave the silver of the ransom to Aaron and to his sons in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 4:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 4:2
content: 2 “Lift up the head of the sons of Kohath from the midst of the sons of Levi, according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers,

title: Numbers 4:3
content: 3 from a son of 30 years and upward and up to a son of 50 years, all who come to the company to do work in the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 4:4
content: 4 This {is} the service of the sons of Kohath in the tent of meeting, the holiest holy things.

title: Numbers 4:5
content: 5 And Aaron and his sons shall come when the camp sets out, and they shall take down the curtain of the covering, and with it they shall cover the box of the testimony.

title: Numbers 4:6
content: 6 And they shall put on it a covering of the skin of the porpoise, and they shall spread a cloth entirely of blue above, and they shall place its poles.

title: Numbers 4:7
content: 7 And over the table of the faces they shall spread a cloth of blue, and they shall put on it the plates and the palm-sized bowls and the bowls and the pitchers of the drink offering, and the bread of continuity shall be on it.

title: Numbers 4:8
content: 8 And they shall spread on them a cloth of the worms of scarlet, and they shall cover it with a covering of the skin of the porpoise, and they shall place its poles.

title: Numbers 4:9
content: 9 And they shall take a cloth of blue and cover the lampstand of the light source and its lamps and its snuffers and its trays and all the vessels of its oil with which they serve it.

title: Numbers 4:10
content: 10 And they shall put it and all its vessels into a covering of the skin of the porpoise, and they shall put {it} on the carrying pole.

title: Numbers 4:11
content: 11 And on the altar of gold they shall spread a cloth of blue, and they shall cover it with a covering of the skin of the porpoise, and they shall place its poles.

title: Numbers 4:12
content: 12 And they shall take all the implements of the service with which they serve in the holy place, and they shall put {them} into a cloth of blue. And they shall cover them with a covering of the skin of the porpoise. And they shall put it on the carrying pole.

title: Numbers 4:13
content: 13 And they shall remove the fatty ashes from the altar, and they shall spread on it a cloth of purple.

title: Numbers 4:14
content: 14 And they shall put on it all its implements with which they serve on it: the trays, the meat forks and the shovels and the bowls—all the implements of the altar. And they shall spread on it a covering of the skin of the porpoise, and they shall place its poles.

title: Numbers 4:15
content: 15 And Aaron and his sons shall finish to cover the holy place and all the implements of the holy place when the camp sets out. And afterward the sons of Kohath shall come to carry {them}, and they shall not touch the holy thing and die. These are the load of the sons of Kohath in the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 4:16
content: 16 And the oversight of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, {is} the oil of the light source and the incense of the spices and the grain offering of the continuity and the oil of the anointment, the oversight of all the Dwelling and all that {is} in it, with the holy place and with its implements.”

title: Numbers 4:17
content: 17 And Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 4:18
content: 18 “Do not let the tribe of the clans of the Kohathite be cut off from the midst of the Levites.

title: Numbers 4:19
content: 19 But do this for them, and they will live and not die when they approach the holiest holy things: Aaron and his sons shall enter and place them man by man in accordance with his service and according to his load.

title: Numbers 4:20
content: 20 But they shall not enter to look at the holy thing like a gulp and die.”

title: Numbers 4:21
content: 21 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 4:22
content: 22 “Lift up the head of the sons of Gershon, even them, according to the house of their fathers, according to their clans.

title: Numbers 4:23
content: 23 You shall count them from a son of 30 years and upward up to a son of 50 years, every one who comes to work work, to serve service in the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 4:24
content: 24 This {is} the service of the clans of the Gershonite, for serving and for a load.

title: Numbers 4:25
content: 25 And they shall carry the curtains of the Dwelling and the tent of meeting, its covering, the covering of porpoise which is on it above, and the covering of the opening of the tent of meeting

title: Numbers 4:26
content: 26 and the hangings of the courtyard and the covering of the opening of the gate of the courtyard that is beside the Dwelling and beside the altar all around, and their ropes and all the implements of their service and all that is to be done for them; and they shall serve.

title: Numbers 4:27
content: 27 In accordance with the mouth of Aaron and his sons will be all the service of the sons of the Gershonite, according to all their load and according to all their service. And you shall appoint to them by responsibility all their load.

title: Numbers 4:28
content: 28 This {is} the service of the clans of the sons of the Gershonite in the tent of meeting and their responsibility in the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers 4:29
content: 29 You shall count them, the sons of Merari, according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers.

title: Numbers 4:30
content: 30 You shall count them from a son of 30 years and upward and up to a son of 50 years, every one who comes to the company, to serve the service of the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 4:31
content: 31 And this {is} the responsibility of their load, according to all their service in the tent of meeting: the frames of the Dwelling and its crossbars and its pillars and its bases

title: Numbers 4:32
content: 32 and the pillars of the courtyard all around and their bases and their pegs and their ropes, for all their implements and for all their service; and by names you shall appoint the implements of the responsibility of their load.

title: Numbers 4:33
content: 33 This {is} the service of the clans of the sons of Merari for all their service in the tent of meeting in the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.”

title: Numbers 4:34
content: 34 And Moses and Aaron and the leaders of the congregation counted the sons of the Kohathite according to their clans and according to the house of their fathers,

title: Numbers 4:35
content: 35 from a son of 30 years and upward and up to a son of 50 years, every one who comes to the company for service in the tent of meeting,

title: Numbers 4:36
content: 36 and their counted ones according to their clans were 2, 750.

title: Numbers 4:37
content: 37 These {were} the counted ones of the clans of the Kohathite, every one who serves in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron had counted in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh by the hand of Moses.

title: Numbers 4:38
content: 38 And the counted ones of the sons of Gershon, according to their clans and according to the house of their fathers,

title: Numbers 4:39
content: 39 from a son of 30 years and upward and up to a son of 50 years, every one who comes to the company for service in the tent of meeting,

title: Numbers 4:40
content: 40 and their counted ones according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers were 2, 630.

title: Numbers 4:41
content: 41 These {were} the counted ones of the clans of the sons of Gershon, every one who serves in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron had counted in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 4:42
content: 42 And the counted ones of the clans of the sons of Merari, according to their clans, according to the house of their fathers,

title: Numbers 4:43
content: 43 from a son of 30 years and upward and up to a son of 50 years, every one who comes to the company for service in the tent of meeting,

title: Numbers 4:44
content: 44 and their counted ones according to their clans were 3, 200.

title: Numbers 4:45
content: 45 These {were} the counted ones of the clans of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron had counted in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh by the hand of Moses.

title: Numbers 4:46
content: 46 All the counted ones whom Moses and Aaron and the leaders of Israel had counted, the Levites according to their clans and according to the house of their fathers,

title: Numbers 4:47
content: 47 from a son of 30 years and upward and up to a son of 50 years, every one who comes to serve the service of service and the service of load in the tent of meeting,

title: Numbers 4:48
content: 48 and their counted ones were 8, 580.

title: Numbers 4:49
content: 49 In accordance with the mouth of Yahweh they were counted by the hand of Moses, man by man in accordance with his service and in accordance with his load. So {these were} his counted ones that Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 5:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 5:2
content: 2 “Command the sons of Israel and they shall send away from the camp every one with an infectious skin disease and every one who flows and every one unclean by a dead person.

title: Numbers 5:3
content: 3 From male up to female you shall send, to the outside of the camp you shall send them. And they shall not defile their camp, because I am dwelling in the midst of them.”

title: Numbers 5:4
content: 4 And the sons of Israel did so, and they sent them to the outside of the camp. Thus the sons of Israel did just as Yahweh had spoken to Moses.

title: Numbers 5:5
content: 5 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 5:6
content: 6 “Speak to the sons of Israel: ‘When a man or woman does from any of the sins of the human to act unfaithfully in unfaithfulness against Yahweh, then that person has done wrong.

title: Numbers 5:7
content: 7 And they shall confess their sin that they did, and he shall return his price of wrongdoing by its head and he shall add its fifth in addition to it, and he shall give to whom he has done wrong to.

title: Numbers 5:8
content: 8 And if there is not a redeemer for the man to return the price of wrongdoing to him, the price of wrongdoing will be returned to Yahweh, to the priest, apart from the ram of the atonement with which he shall make atonement for him.

title: Numbers 5:9
content: 9 And every contribution of all the holy things of the sons of Israel that they offer to the priest, it shall belong to him.

title: Numbers 5:10
content: 10 And a man, his holy things shall belong to him; what a man gives to the priest shall belong to him.’”

title: Numbers 5:11
content: 11 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 5:12
content: 12 “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘Man by man, if his wife turns aside and acts unfaithfully against him in unfaithfulness,

title: Numbers 5:13
content: 13 and a man lies the lying of seed with her and it is concealed from the eyes of her husband, and it is hidden, and she herself is defiled, and there is no witness against her, and she herself has not been caught,

title: Numbers 5:14
content: 14 and a spirit of jealousy passes over on him and he is jealous of his wife and she herself is defiled, or a spirit of jealousy comes over on him and he is jealous of his wife but she herself is not defiled;

title: Numbers 5:15
content: 15 then the man shall bring his wife to the priest. And he shall bring her offering for her, the tenth of the ephah of the flour of barley. He shall not pour oil on it, and he shall not put frankincense on it, for it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of remembrance, one that causes iniquity to be remembered.

title: Numbers 5:16
content: 16 And the priest shall bring her near, and he shall stand her before the face of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 5:17
content: 17 And the priest shall take the holy water in the vessel of clay, and the priest shall take some of the dust that is on the floor of the Dwelling, and he shall put it into the water.

title: Numbers 5:18
content: 18 And the priest shall stand the woman before the face of Yahweh, and he shall unbind the head of the woman, and he shall put on her palm the grain offering of remembrance. It is the grain offering of jealousy. And in the hand of the priest shall be the water of bitterness that brings a curse.

title: Numbers 5:19
content: 19 And the priest shall make her swear, and he shall say to the woman, “If a man has not lain with you, and if you have not turned aside to uncleanness under your husband, you will be free from this water of bitterness that brings a curse.

title: Numbers 5:20
content: 20 But if you have turned aside under your husband, and if you are defiled and a man apart from your husband has given his lying with you,”

title: Numbers 5:21
content: 21 (and the priest shall make the woman swear with an oath of the curse). And the priest shall say to the woman, “Yahweh will make you into a curse and into an oath in the midst of your people when Yahweh makes your thigh fall away and your abdomen swell.

title: Numbers 5:22
content: 22 And this water that brings a curse will enter in your inward parts to cause swelling of the abdomen and to cause falling away of your thigh.” And the woman shall say, “Truly, truly.”

title: Numbers 5:23
content: 23 And the priest shall write these curses in the book, and he shall wipe it off into the water of bitterness.

title: Numbers 5:24
content: 24 And he shall cause the woman to drink the water of bitterness that brings a curse, and the water that brings a curse of bitterness will enter in her.

title: Numbers 5:25
content: 25 And the priest shall take the grain offering of jealousy from the hand of the woman, and he shall wave the grain offering before the face of Yahweh, and he shall bring it near to the altar.

title: Numbers 5:26
content: 26 And the priest shall grasp from the grain offering its memorial portion and he shall burn it up at the altar. And after he shall make the woman drink the water.

title: Numbers 5:27
content: 27 And he shall make her drink the water. And it will be that if she is defiled and has acted unfaithfully in unfaithfulness with her husband, then the water that brings a curse of bitterness will enter in her, and her abdomen will swell, and her thigh will fall away, and the woman will become a curse in the midst of her people.

title: Numbers 5:28
content: 28 And if the woman is not defiled, then she herself is clean, and she will be free, and she will be sown with seed.

title: Numbers 5:29
content: 29 This is the law of jealousy when a woman turns aside under her husband and is defiled,

title: Numbers 5:30
content: 30 or a man, when a spirit of jealousy passes over on him and he is jealous of his wife, and he shall stand the woman before the face of Yahweh, and the priest shall do all this law to her.

title: Numbers 5:31
content: 31 And the man will be free from iniquity, and this woman will carry her iniquity.’”

title: Numbers 6:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 6:2
content: 2 “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When a man or a woman does something extraordinary by vowing the vow of a separate one to separate to Yahweh,

title: Numbers 6:3
content: 3 he shall separate from wine and intoxicating drink. He shall not drink the vinegar of wine and the vinegar of intoxicating drink, and he shall not drink any of the juice of grapes, and he shall not eat moist and dried grapes.

title: Numbers 6:4
content: 4 All the days of his separation, he shall not eat from all that is made from the vine of the wine, from seeds and up to skin.

title: Numbers 6:5
content: 5 All the days of the vow of his separation, a razor shall not pass over his head. Until the fulfilling of the days that he has separated to Yahweh, he shall be holy; the locks of the hair of his head shall grow long.

title: Numbers 6:6
content: 6 All the days of his separation to Yahweh he shall not go near a person who is dead.

title: Numbers 6:7
content: 7 For his father and for his mother, for his brother and for his sister, he shall not defile himself for them with their death, because the separation of his God is on his head.

title: Numbers 6:8
content: 8 All the days of his separation he shall be holy to Yahweh.

title: Numbers 6:9
content: 9 And if one who is dead dies near him in suddenness suddenly, and he defiles the head of his separation, then he shall shave his head on the day of his cleansing; on the seventh day he shall shave it,

title: Numbers 6:10
content: 10 and on the eighth day he shall bring two of the turtledoves or two of the sons of the dove to the priest, to the opening of the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 6:11
content: 11 And the priest shall make one for a sin offering and one for a burnt offering, and he shall make atonement for him, because he sinned on account of the person. And he shall make his head holy on that day.

title: Numbers 6:12
content: 12 And he shall separate to Yahweh the days of his separation, and he shall bring a male lamb, a son of his year, for a guilt offering. And the first days shall fall, because his separation was defiled.

title: Numbers 6:13
content: 13 And this is the law of the separate one: On a day fulfilling the days of his separation, he shall bring him to the opening of the tent of meeting,

title: Numbers 6:14
content: 14 and he shall offer his offering to Yahweh: one male lamb without defect, a son of his year, for a burnt offering; and one female lamb without defect, a daughter of her year, for a sin offering, and one ram without defect for peace offerings,

title: Numbers 6:15
content: 15 and a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mixed with the oil, and wafers of unleavened bread smeared with the oil and their grain offering and their drink offerings.

title: Numbers 6:16
content: 16 And the priest shall offer before the face of Yahweh, and he shall make his sin offering and his burnt offering.

title: Numbers 6:17
content: 17 And he shall make the ram a sacrifice of peace offerings to Yahweh with the basket of the unleavened bread. And the priest shall make his grain offering and his drink offering.

title: Numbers 6:18
content: 18 And the separate one shall shave the head of his separation at the opening of the tent of meeting, and he shall take the hair of the head of his separation, and he shall put it on the fire that is under the sacrifice of the peace offerings.

title: Numbers 6:19
content: 19 And the priest shall take the boiled shoulder from the ram and one cake of unleavened bread from the basket and one wafer of unleavened bread, and he shall put them on the palms of the separate one after his shaving his separation.

title: Numbers 6:20
content: 20 And the priest shall wave them as a wave offering before the face of Yahweh. It is a holy thing to the priest with the breast of the wave offering and with the thigh of the contribution. And after, the separate one may drink wine.

title: Numbers 6:21
content: 21 This is the law of the separate one who vows his offering to Yahweh for his separation, apart from what his hand reaches. According to the mouth of his vow that he vowed, so he shall do in accordance with the law of his separation.’”

title: Numbers 6:22
content: 22 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 6:23
content: 23 “Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, ‘Thus you shall bless the sons of Israel, saying to them,

title: Numbers 6:24
content: 24 “May Yahweh bless you and keep you.

title: Numbers 6:25
content: 25 May Yahweh cause his face to shine to you and may he be gracious to you.

title: Numbers 6:26
content: 26 May Yahweh lift up his face to you and may he set peace for you.”’

title: Numbers 6:27
content: 27 And they shall set my name on the sons of Israel and I shall bless them.”

title: Numbers 7:1
content: 1 And it happened on the day Moses finished erecting the Dwelling that he anointed it and made it holy and all its vessels and the altar and all its vessels. And he anointed them and made them holy.

title: Numbers 7:2
content: 2 And the leaders of Israel, the heads of the house of their fathers, made an offering. They were the leaders of the tribes. They were the ones standing over the counted ones.

title: Numbers 7:3
content: 3 And they brought their offering before the face of Yahweh, six covered carts and twelve cattle, a cart for two of the leaders and an ox for one. And they offered them before the face of the Dwelling.

title: Numbers 7:4
content: 4 And Yahweh said to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 7:5
content: 5 “Take from with them and they shall be for serving the service of the tent of meeting. And you shall give them to the Levites, a man according to the mouth of his service.”

title: Numbers 7:6
content: 6 And Moses took the carts and the cattle, and he gave them to the Levites.

title: Numbers 7:7
content: 7 He gave two of the carts and four of the cattle to the sons of Gershon, according to the mouth of their service.

title: Numbers 7:8
content: 8 And he gave four of the carts and eight of the cattle to the sons of Merari, according to the mouth of their service, by the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers 7:9
content: 9 But he did not give to the sons of Kohath, for the service of the holy place was on them; they carried on the shoulder.

title: Numbers 7:10
content: 10 And the leaders offered the dedication of the altar on the day it was anointed. And the leaders offered their offering before the face of the altar.

title: Numbers 7:11
content: 11 And Yahweh said to Moses, “One leader for the day, one leader for the day shall they offer their offering for the dedication of the altar.”

title: Numbers 7:12
content: 12 And it happened that the one who offered his offering on the first day was Nahshon, the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah.

title: Numbers 7:13
content: 13 And his offering was one silver dish (its weight was 130), one silver bowl of 70 shekels by the shekel of the holy place—the two of them were full of fine flour mixed with the oil for a grain offering,

title: Numbers 7:14
content: 14 one palm-sized bowl of ten gold full of incense,

title: Numbers 7:15
content: 15 one bull, a son of cattle, one ram, one male lamb, a son of his year, for a burnt offering,

title: Numbers 7:16
content: 16 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

title: Numbers 7:17
content: 17 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This {was} the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

title: Numbers 7:18
content: 18 On the second day, Nethanel the son of Zuar, the leader of Issachar, made an offering.

title: Numbers 7:19
content: 19 He offered his offering: one silver dish (its weight was 130), one silver bowl of 70 shekels by the shekel of the holy place—the two of them were full of fine flour mixed with the oil for a grain offering,

title: Numbers 7:20
content: 20 one palm-sized bowl of ten gold full of incense,

title: Numbers 7:21
content: 21 one bull, a son of cattle, one ram, one male lamb, a son of his year, for a burnt offering,

title: Numbers 7:22
content: 22 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

title: Numbers 7:23
content: 23 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.

title: Numbers 7:24
content: 24 On the third day, the leader of the sons of Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon:

title: Numbers 7:25

content: 26 one palm-sized bowl of ten gold, full of incense,

content: 27 one bull, a son of cattle, one ram, one male lamb, a son of his year, for a burnt offering,

title: Numbers 7:28
content: 28 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

title: Numbers 7:29
content: 29 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.

title: Numbers 7:30
content: 30 On the fourth day, the leader of the sons of Reuben, Elizur the son of Shedeur:

content: 34 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

title: Numbers 7:35
content: 35 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.

title: Numbers 7:36
content: 36 On the fifth day, the leader of the sons of Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai:

title: Numbers 7:37

content: 38 one palm-sized bowl of ten gold, full of incense,

title: Numbers 7:39

title: Numbers 7:40
content: 40 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

title: Numbers 7:41
content: 41 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

title: Numbers 7:42
content: 42 On the sixth day, the leader of the sons of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Deuel:

title: Numbers 7:43

title: Numbers 7:44
content: 44 one palm-sized bowl of ten gold, full of incense,

title: Numbers 7:45
content: 45 one bull, a son of cattle, one ram, one male lamb, a son of his year, for a burnt offering,

title: Numbers 7:46
content: 46 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

title: Numbers 7:47
content: 47 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Eliasaph the son of Deuel.

title: Numbers 7:48
content: 48 On the seventh day, the leader of the sons of Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud:

title: Numbers 7:49

title: Numbers 7:50
content: 50 one palm-sized bowl of ten gold, full of incense,

title: Numbers 7:51
content: 51 one bull, a son of cattle, one ram, one male lamb, a son of his year, for a burnt offering,

content: 52 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

content: 53 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.

content: 59 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

content: 63 one bull, a son of cattle, one ram, one male lamb, a son of his year, for a burnt offering,

content: 64 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

content: 65 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.

content: 70 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

content: 71 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

title: Numbers 7:72
content: 72 On the day of the eleventh day, the leader of the sons of Asher, Pagiel the son of Okran:

title: Numbers 7:73
content: 73 his offering was one silver dish (its weight was 130), one silver bowl of 70 shekels by the shekel of the holy place—the two of them were full of fine flour mixed with the oil for a grain offering,

title: Numbers 7:74
content: 74 one palm-sized bowl of ten gold, full of incense,

title: Numbers 7:75
content: 75 one bull, a son of cattle, one ram, one male lamb, a son of his year, for a burnt offering,

title: Numbers 7:76
content: 76 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

title: Numbers 7:77
content: 77 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Pagiel the son of Okran.

title: Numbers 7:78
content: 78 On the day of the twelfth day, the leader of the sons of Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan:

title: Numbers 7:79
content: 79 his offering was one silver dish (its weight was 130), one silver bowl of 70 shekels by the shekel of the holy place—the two of them were full of fine flour mixed with the oil for a grain offering,

title: Numbers 7:80
content: 80 one palm-sized bowl of ten gold, full of incense,

title: Numbers 7:81
content: 81 one bull, a son of cattle, one ram, one male lamb, a son of his year, for a burnt offering,

title: Numbers 7:82
content: 82 one buck of the goats for a sin offering,

title: Numbers 7:83
content: 83 and for the sacrifice of the peace offerings: two cattle, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs, sons of a year. This was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.

title: Numbers 7:84
content: 84 This is the dedication of the altar on the day it was anointed from with the leaders of Israel: 12 dishes of silver, 12 bowls of silver, 12 palm-sized bowls of gold.

title: Numbers 7:85
content: 85 One silver bowl was 130 and one bowl was 70. All the silver of the vessels was 2, 400 by the shekel of the holy place.

title: Numbers 7:86
content: 86 The palm-sized bowls of gold were 12, full of incense. The palm-sized bowl was ten by ten by the shekel of the holy place. All the gold of the palm-sized bowls was 120.

title: Numbers 7:87
content: 87 All the cattle for the burnt offering were 12 bulls, 12 rams, 12 male lambs, sons of a year, and their grain offering. And 12 bucks of the goats were for a sin offering.

title: Numbers 7:88
content: 88 And all the cattle of the sacrifice of the peace offerings were 24 bulls, 60 rams, 60 male goats, 60 male lambs, sons of a year. This is the dedication of the altar after it was anointed.

title: Numbers 7:89
content: 89 And when Moses entered into the tent of meeting to speak with him, then he heard the voice speaking to him from above the atonement lid that is on the box of the testimony, from between the two cherubim. And he spoke to him.

title: Numbers 8:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 8:2
content: 2 “Speak to Aaron and say to him, ‘When you lift up the lamps to the front of the face of the lampstand, the seven lamps shall give light.’”

title: Numbers 8:3
content: 3 And Aaron did so. To the front of the face of the lampstand he lifted up its lamps, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 8:4
content: 4 And this {is} the work of the lampstand: a hammered gold work; it {was} a hammered work up to its base, up to its blossom. According to the appearance that Yahweh showed Moses, so he made the lampstand.

title: Numbers 8:5
content: 5 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 8:6
content: 6 “Take the Levites from the midst of the sons of Israel and make them clean.

title: Numbers 8:7
content: 7 And thus you shall do to them to make them clean: Sprinkle on them the water of the sin offering. And they shall pass a razor over all their body, and they shall wash their garments, and they shall make themselves clean.

title: Numbers 8:8
content: 8 And they shall take a bull, a son of cattle, and its grain offering of fine flour mixed with the oil. And you shall take a second bull, a son of cattle, for a sin offering.

title: Numbers 8:9
content: 9 And you shall bring the Levites near before the face of the tent of meeting. And you shall assemble all the congregation of the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 8:10
content: 10 And you shall bring the Levites near before the face of Yahweh, and the sons of Israel shall lay their hands on the Levites.

title: Numbers 8:11
content: 11 And Aaron shall wave the Levites as a wave offering before the face of Yahweh from with the sons of Israel. And they shall be for serving the service of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 8:12
content: 12 And the Levites shall lay their hands on the head of the bulls and make the one as a sin offering and the one as a burnt offering to Yahweh, to make atonement for the Levites.

title: Numbers 8:13
content: 13 And you shall stand the Levites before the face of Aaron and before the face of his sons, and you shall wave them as a wave offering to Yahweh.

title: Numbers 8:14
content: 14 And you shall separate the Levites from the midst of the sons of Israel, and the Levites shall be for me.

title: Numbers 8:15
content: 15 And afterwards the Levites shall enter to serve the tent of meeting. And you shall make them clean and you shall wave them as a wave offering,

title: Numbers 8:16
content: 16 for they are given, given to me from the midst of the sons of Israel. Instead of the opener of every womb, the firstborn of all from the sons of Israel, I have taken them for myself.

title: Numbers 8:17
content: 17 For every firstborn among the sons of Israel, among the human and among the livestock, belongs to me. On the day of my striking every firstborn in the land of Egypt, I set them apart for me.

title: Numbers 8:18
content: 18 And I have taken the Levites instead of every firstborn among the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 8:19
content: 19 And I have given the Levites as given ones to Aaron and to his sons, from the midst of the sons of Israel, to serve the service of the sons of Israel in the tent of meeting and to make atonement for the sons of Israel. And there shall be no plague among the sons of Israel at the coming of the sons of Israel to the holy place.”

title: Numbers 8:20
content: 20 And Moses and Aaron and all the assembly of the sons of Israel did to the Levites according to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses for the Levites; so the sons of Israel did to them.

title: Numbers 8:21
content: 21 And the Levites purified themselves of sin, and they washed their garments, and Aaron waved them as a wave offering before the face of Yahweh, and Aaron made atonement for them to make them clean.

title: Numbers 8:22
content: 22 And afterward the Levites entered to serve their service in the tent of meeting before the face of Aaron and before the face of his sons. Just as Yahweh had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so he did to them.

title: Numbers 8:23
content: 23 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 8:24
content: 24 “This is what is for the Levites: From a son of 25 years and above he shall enter to work work in the service of the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 8:25
content: 25 And from a son of 50 years he shall return from the work of the service, and he shall not serve more.

title: Numbers 8:26
content: 26 And he shall attend his brothers in the tent of meeting to keep responsibility, but service he shall not serve. Thus you shall do for the Levites in their responsibilities.”

title: Numbers 9:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the second year of their going out from the land of Egypt, in the first month, saying,

title: Numbers 9:2
content: 2 “And let the sons of Israel do the Passover at its appointed time.

title: Numbers 9:3
content: 3 On day 14 in this month, between the evenings, you shall do it at its appointed time. According to all its statutes and according to all its ordinances you shall do it.”

title: Numbers 9:4
content: 4 And Moses spoke to the sons of Israel to do the Passover.

title: Numbers 9:5
content: 5 And they did the Passover in the first, on day 14 of the month, between the evenings, in the wilderness of Sinai. According to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses, so did the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 9:6
content: 6 And there were men who were unclean by the body of a man, and they were not able to do the Passover on that day. And they came near before the face of Moses and before the face of Aaron on that day.

title: Numbers 9:7
content: 7 And those men said to him, “We are unclean by the body of a man. Why are we restrained to not offer an offering of Yahweh at its appointed time in the midst of the sons of Israel?”

title: Numbers 9:8
content: 8 And Moses said to them, “Stand and I shall hear what Yahweh commands for you.”

title: Numbers 9:9
content: 9 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 9:10
content: 10 “Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘If a man, a man is unclean by a body or is on a distant road, for you or for your generations, then he may do the Passover to Yahweh.

title: Numbers 9:11
content: 11 In the second month on day 14 between the evenings, they shall do it. With unleavened bread and bitter herbs they shall eat it.

title: Numbers 9:12
content: 12 They shall not leave some of it until morning, and a bone they shall not break in it. According to every statute of the Passover they shall do it.

title: Numbers 9:13
content: 13 And the man, he who is clean and is not on a road, but ceases to do the Passover, now that person shall be cut off from his people because he did not offer the offering of Yahweh at its appointed time. That man shall carry his sin.

title: Numbers 9:14
content: 14 And if a sojourner sojourns with you and does the Passover to Yahweh according to the statute of the Passover and according to its ordinance, so he shall do. One statute shall be for you and for the sojourner and for the native of the land.’”

title: Numbers 9:15
content: 15 And on the day of raising up the Dwelling, the cloud covered the Dwelling of the tent of the testimony, and in the evening it was above the Dwelling like the appearance of fire until morning.

title: Numbers 9:16
content: 16 So it was continually; the cloud covered it, and the appearance of fire at night.

title: Numbers 9:17
content: 17 And according to the mouth the cloud was lifted from above the tent, then afterward the sons of Israel set out. And in the place there where the cloud dwelled, there the sons of Israel camped.

title: Numbers 9:18
content: 18 In accordance with the mouth of Yahweh the sons of Israel set out, and in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh they camped. They camped all the days that the cloud dwelled above the Dwelling.

title: Numbers 9:19
content: 19 And when the cloud prolonged above the Dwelling many days, then the sons of Israel kept the keeping of Yahweh and did not set out.

title: Numbers 9:20
content: 20 And it was when the cloud was days of number above the Dwelling, they camped in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh, and they set out in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 9:21
content: 21 And it was when the cloud was from evening until morning and the cloud was taken up in the morning then they set out; or in the daytime and night, and the cloud was taken up, then they set out.

title: Numbers 9:22
content: 22 Whether two days or a month or days, when the cloud prolonged above the Dwelling to dwell above it, the sons of Israel camped and did not set out. And when it was taken up, they set out.

title: Numbers 9:23
content: 23 They camped in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh, and they set out in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh. They kept the keeping of Yahweh, in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh by the hand of Moses.

title: Numbers 10:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 10:2
content: 2 “Make for you two trumpets of silver. You shall make them hammered work, and they shall be for you for the calling of the congregation and for pulling up the camps,

title: Numbers 10:3
content: 3 and they shall blow them and they shall congregate themselves to you, all the congregation, to the opening of the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 10:4
content: 4 And if they blow one, then the leaders, the heads of the thousands of Israel, shall congregate themselves to you,

title: Numbers 10:5
content: 5 and you shall blow a blast and the camps camping to the east shall set out,

title: Numbers 10:6
content: 6 and you shall blow a second blast and the camps camping to the south shall set out. They shall blow a blast for their setting out,

title: Numbers 10:7
content: 7 and when assembling the assembly, you shall blow but you shall not blast.

title: Numbers 10:8
content: 8 And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow the trumpets, and it shall be for you for a statute forever, for your generations.

title: Numbers 10:9
content: 9 And when you enter battle in your land against the opponents who oppose you, then you shall blast the trumpets, and you shall be remembered before the face of Yahweh your God, and you shall be saved from your enemies.

title: Numbers 10:10
content: 10 And on a day of your joy and at your appointed times and at the heads of your months, then you shall blow the trumpets with your burnt offerings and with the sacrifices of your peace offerings, and it will be for you for a memorial before the face of your God. I am Yahweh your God.”

title: Numbers 10:11
content: 11 And it happened that in the second year, in the second month, on 20 in the month, the cloud was taken up from above the Dwelling of the Testimony.

title: Numbers 10:12
content: 12 And the sons of Israel set out from the wilderness of Sinai according to their tribes, and the cloud dwelled in the wilderness of Paran,

title: Numbers 10:13
content: 13 and they set out at the first in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh by the hand of Moses.

title: Numbers 10:14
content: 14 And the banner of the camp of the sons of Judah set out at the first according to their armies: and over his army was Nahson the son of Amminadab,

title: Numbers 10:15
content: 15 and over the army of the tribe of the sons of Issachar was Nethanel the son of Zuar,

title: Numbers 10:16
content: 16 and over the army of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun was Eliab the son of Helon.

title: Numbers 10:17
content: 17 And the Dwelling was taken down, and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, the lifters of the Dwelling, set out.

title: Numbers 10:18
content: 18 And the banner of the tribe of Reuben set out according to their armies: and over his company was Elizur the son of Shedeur,

title: Numbers 10:19
content: 19 and over the army of the tribe of the sons of Simeon was Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai,

title: Numbers 10:20
content: 20 and over the army of the tribe of the sons of Gad was Eliasaph the son of Deuel.

title: Numbers 10:21
content: 21 And the Kohathites, lifters of the holy place, set out, and they raised up the Dwelling until their coming.

title: Numbers 10:22
content: 22 And the banner of the camp of the sons of Ephraim set out according to their armies, and over his army was Elishama the son of Ammihud,

title: Numbers 10:23
content: 23 and over the army of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh was Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur,

title: Numbers 10:24
content: 24 and over the army of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin was Abidan the son of Gideoni.

title: Numbers 10:25
content: 25 And the banner of the camp of the sons of Dan, gatherer for all the camps according to their armies, set out, and over his army was Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

title: Numbers 10:26
content: 26 And over the army of the tribe of the sons of Asher was Pagiel the son of Okran,

title: Numbers 10:27
content: 27 and over the army of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali was Ahira the son of Enan.

title: Numbers 10:28
content: 28 These were the tribes of the sons of Israel according to their armies. And they set out.

title: Numbers 10:29
content: 29 And Moses said to Hobab, the son of Reuel the Midianite, the father-in-law of Moses, “We are about to set out to the place that Yahweh said, ‘I shall give it to you.’ Go with us, and we will do good to you. For Yahweh has spoken good for Israel.”

title: Numbers 10:30
content: 30 And he said to him, “I will not go, but I will go to my land and to my family.”

title: Numbers 10:31
content: 31 And he said, “Please do not leave us! Because you know our camping in the wilderness, and you could be for eyes for us.

title: Numbers 10:32
content: 32 And it will happen that if you go with us, then it will happen that that good which Yahweh shall do good with us, even we will do good to you.”

title: Numbers 10:33
content: 33 And they set out from the mountain of Yahweh a road of three days, and the box of the covenant of Yahweh was setting out before the face of them a road of three days, to seek out for them a resting place,

title: Numbers 10:34
content: 34 and the cloud of Yahweh was over them by day when they set out from the camp.

title: Numbers 10:35
content: 35 And it happened, when the box set out, that Moses said, “Rise up, Yahweh, and your enemies will be scattered, and those who hate you will flee from your face.”

title: Numbers 10:36
content: 36 And when it rested, he said, “Return, Yahweh, to the multitudes of the thousands of Israel.”

title: Numbers 11:1
content: 1 And when the people were complaining it was evil in the ears of Yahweh, and Yahweh heard and his nose burned, and the fire of Yahweh burned among them, and it ate at the end of the camp.

title: Numbers 11:2
content: 2 And the people cried out to Moses, and Moses prayed to Yahweh and the fire sank;

title: Numbers 11:3
content: 3 and the name of that place was called Taberah, for the fire of Yahweh burned among them.

title: Numbers 11:4
content: 4 And the gathered rabble that was in its inner part desired a desire, and they turned back, and they wept, also the sons of Israel. And they said, “Who will let us eat meat?

title: Numbers 11:5
content: 5 We remember the fish that we ate in Egypt for nothing, the cucumbers, and the melons, and the leeks, and the onions, and the garlic.

title: Numbers 11:6
content: 6 And now our life is dried up, there is not anything except for the manna in our eyes.”

title: Numbers 11:7
content: 7 And the manna, it was like the seed of coriander, and its eye was like the eye of bdellium.

title: Numbers 11:8
content: 8 The people went around and picked up and ground with the handmill or crushed with the mortar and boiled in the pot and made it cakes, and its taste was like the taste of the delicacy of the oil,

title: Numbers 11:9
content: 9 and when the dew came down on the camp at night, the manna came down on it.

title: Numbers 11:10
content: 10 And Moses heard the people weeping according to its clans, a man to the opening of his tent; and the nose of Yahweh burned exceedingly, and it was evil in the eyes of Moses.

title: Numbers 11:11
content: 11 And Moses said to Yahweh, “Why do you do evil to your servant? And why have I not found favor in your eyes, by putting the burden of all this people on me?

title: Numbers 11:12
content: 12 Did I conceive all of this people? Did I give birth to him so that you could say to me, ‘Carry him in your bosom just as the one who nourishes carries the one who sucks over the ground that you have sworn to his fathers?’

title: Numbers 11:13
content: 13 From where is meat for me to give to all of this people? For they weep beside me, saying, ‘Give to us meat and let us eat.’

title: Numbers 11:14
content: 14 I am not able by myself to carry all of this people, for they are heavier than me.

title: Numbers 11:15
content: 15 And if you are going to do thus to me, please slay me quickly, if I have found favor in your eyes, and do not let me look on my evil.”

title: Numbers 11:16
content: 16 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Gather for me 70 men from the elders of Israel whom you know, so that they will be elders of the people and its officers, and take them to the tent of meeting, and they shall station themselves there with you.

title: Numbers 11:17
content: 17 And I will come down and speak with you there, and I will withdraw some of the spirit that is on you and put it on them, and they will carry with you the burden of the people, and you will not carry by yourself.

title: Numbers 11:18
content: 18 And to the people you shall say, ‘Make yourselves holy for tomorrow, and you shall eat meat. For you have wept in the ears of Yahweh, saying, “Who will let us eat meat? For it was good for us in Egypt.” And Yahweh will give to you meat, and you will eat.

title: Numbers 11:19
content: 19 You will eat not one day and not two days and not five days and not ten days and not twenty days,

title: Numbers 11:20
content: 20 until a month of days, until when it goes out from your nose. And it shall be for disgust for you, because that you rejected Yahweh who is in the midst of you, and you wept before his face, saying, “Why this—we went out from Egypt?”’”

title: Numbers 11:21
content: 21 And Moses said, “The people are 600, 000 on foot who I am in the midst of, and you have said, ‘I shall give to them meat and they shall eat a month of days.’

title: Numbers 11:22
content: 22 Shall flock and herd be slaughtered for them and one find for them? If all the fish of the sea were gathered for them, then will one find for them?”

title: Numbers 11:23
content: 23 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Is the hand of Yahweh short? Now you will see whether my word will happen to you or not.”

title: Numbers 11:24
content: 24 And Moses went out and he spoke to the people the words of Yahweh. And he gathered 70 men from the elders of the people, and he had them stand round about the tent.

title: Numbers 11:25
content: 25 And Yahweh came down in the cloud and he spoke to him, and he withdrew some of the spirit that was on him, and he put it on 70 men, the elders. And it happened when the spirit rested on them that they prophesied but did not again.

title: Numbers 11:26
content: 26 And two of the men were left in the camp: The name of the one was Eldad, and the name of the second was Medad. And the spirit rested on them, and they were among the written down ones, but they had not gone out to the tent; and they prophesied in the camp.

title: Numbers 11:27
content: 27 And the young man ran and reported to Moses, and he said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.”

title: Numbers 11:28
content: 28 And Joshua the son of Nun, the server of Moses from his youth, responded and said, “My master Moses, restrain them.”

title: Numbers 11:29
content: 29 And Moses said to him, “Are you being jealous for me? And if only he would make all the people of Yahweh prophets, that Yahweh would put his Spirit on them!”

title: Numbers 11:30
content: 30 And Moses withdrew to the camp, he and the elders of Israel.

title: Numbers 11:31
content: 31 And a wind set out from with Yahweh, and it brought over quail from the sea, and it left on the camp like a road of a day here and like a road of a day here, round about the camp, and like two cubits on the face of the land.

title: Numbers 11:32
content: 32 And the people rose all that day and all the night and all the day of the next day, and they gathered the quail. The one who did little gathered ten homers. And they spread out for them, spreading out round about the camp.

title: Numbers 11:33
content: 33 The meat was still between their teeth–before it was chewed–and the nose of Yahweh burned against the people, and Yahweh struck the people an exceedingly great blow,

title: Numbers 11:34
content: 34 and he called the name of that place Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people who had desired.

title: Numbers 11:35
content: 35 From Kibroth Hattaavah the people set out to Hazeroth. Then they were in Hazeroth.

title: Numbers 12:1
content: 1 And Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses on account of the Cushite wife that he had taken, because he had taken a Cushite wife.

title: Numbers 12:2
content: 2 And they said, “Has Yahweh really only spoken with Moses? Has he not spoken also with us?” And Yahweh heard.

title: Numbers 12:3
content: 3 (And the man Moses was exceedingly humble, more than every human who was on the face of the ground.)

title: Numbers 12:4
content: 4 And Yahweh said immediately to Moses and to Aaron and to Miriam, “The three of you go out to the tent of meeting,” and the three of them went out.

title: Numbers 12:5
content: 5 And Yahweh came down in a column of cloud, and he stood at the opening of the tent, and he called Aaron and Miriam and the two of them went out.

title: Numbers 12:6
content: 6 And he said, “Hear now my words! If one is your prophet, I, Yahweh will make myself known to him in the vision. I will speak with him in the dream.

title: Numbers 12:7
content: 7 Not so my servant Moses; he is trustworthy in all my house.

title: Numbers 12:8
content: 8 I speak with him mouth to mouth, and with appearance, and not with riddles; and he looks at the form of Yahweh. And why are you not afraid to speak against my servant, against Moses?”

title: Numbers 12:9
content: 9 And the nose of Yahweh burned against them and he went,

title: Numbers 12:10
content: 10 and the cloud departed from over the tent. And behold, Miriam was with a skin disease, like the snow, and Aaron turned to Miriam, and behold, she was with a skin disease,

title: Numbers 12:11
content: 11 and Aaron said to Moses, “Please, my master, please do not put on us sin which we did foolishly and which we sinned.

title: Numbers 12:12
content: 12 Please do not let her be like the dead one who, when he comes out from the womb of his mother, then half of his flesh is eaten.”

title: Numbers 12:13
content: 13 And Moses cried out to Yahweh, saying, “God, please, please heal her!”

title: Numbers 12:14
content: 14 And Yahweh said to Moses, “If her father surely spit in her face, would she not be humiliated seven days? She shall be shut up seven days from outside of the camp, and afterward she may be brought in.”

title: Numbers 12:15
content: 15 And Miriam was shut up from outside of the camp seven days, and the people did not set out until the bringing in of Miriam.

title: Numbers 12:16
content: 16 And after, the people set out from Hazeroth, and they camped in the wilderness of Paran.

title: Numbers 13:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 13:2
content: 2 “Send for yourself men, and they shall explore the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the sons of Israel. You shall send one man by one man according to the tribe of his fathers, every leader among them.”

title: Numbers 13:3
content: 3 And Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh. All of them were men, they were the heads of the sons of Israel,

title: Numbers 13:4
content: 4 and these are their names: of the tribe of Reuben was Shammua the son of Zaccur;

title: Numbers 13:5
content: 5 of the tribe of Simeon was Shaphat the son of Hori;

title: Numbers 13:6
content: 6 of the tribe of Judah was Caleb the son of Jephunneh;

title: Numbers 13:7
content: 7 of the tribe of Issachar was Igal the son of Joseph;

title: Numbers 13:8
content: 8 of the tribe of Ephraim was Hoshea the son of Nun;

title: Numbers 13:9
content: 9 of the tribe of Benjamin was Palti the son of Raphu;

title: Numbers 13:10
content: 10 of the tribe of Zebulun was Gaddiel the son of Sodi;

title: Numbers 13:11
content: 11 of the tribe of Joseph, of the tribe of Manasseh, was Gaddi the son of Susi;

title: Numbers 13:12
content: 12 of the tribe of Dan was Ammiel the son of Gemalli;

title: Numbers 13:13
content: 13 of the tribe of Asher was Sethur the son of Michael;

title: Numbers 13:14
content: 14 of the tribe of Naphtali was Nahbi the son of Vophsi;

title: Numbers 13:15
content: 15 of the tribe of Gad was Geuel the son of Maki.

title: Numbers 13:16
content: 16 These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to explore the land; and Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun, Joshua.

title: Numbers 13:17
content: 17 And Moses sent them to explore the land of Canaan, and he said to them, “Go up here through the Negev, and you shall go up the hill country.

title: Numbers 13:18
content: 18 And you shall see the land, how it is; and the people who dwell on it, whether he is strong or weak, whether he is few or many;

title: Numbers 13:19
content: 19 and how is the land in which he is dwelling, whether it is good or evil; and how are the cities in which he is dwelling, whether in camps or in fortifications;

title: Numbers 13:20
content: 20 and how is the land, whether it is fat or lean, whether there are trees in it or not, and you shall strengthen yourselves, and you shall take from the fruit of the land.” (And the days were the days of the firstfruits of the grapes.)

title: Numbers 13:21
content: 21 And they went up, and they explored the land from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, to enter Hamath.

title: Numbers 13:22
content: 22 And they went up through the Negev and they came to Hebron. And Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, those born of the Anak, were there. (And Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan of Egypt.)

title: Numbers 13:23
content: 23 And they came to the wadi of Eschol, and from there they cut a branch and one cluster of grapes, and they carried it by the carrying pole with two men, and some of the pomegranates and some of the figs.

title: Numbers 13:24
content: 24 He called that place the wadi of Eshkol on account of the cluster that the sons of Israel cut from there.

title: Numbers 13:25
content: 25 And they returned from exploring the land at the end of 40 days,

title: Numbers 13:26
content: 26 and they went and they came to Moses and to Aaron and to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, to the wilderness of Paran at Kadesh. And they brought back them and all the congregation word, and they showed them the fruit of the land,

title: Numbers 13:27
content: 27 and they recounted to him, and they said, “We entered into the land where you sent us, and it is certainly flowing with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.

title: Numbers 13:28
content: 28 However, the people who dwell in the land are fierce, and the cities are fortified very large, and also we saw those born of the Anak there.

title: Numbers 13:29
content: 29 Amalek is dwelling in the land of the Negev, and the Hittite and the Jebusite and the Amorite is dwelling in the hill country, and the Canaanite is dwelling beside the sea and beside the hand of the Jordan.”

title: Numbers 13:30
content: 30 And Caleb hushed the people near Moses and he said, “We will certainly go up and take possession of it, for we are certainly able to prevail over it.”

title: Numbers 13:31
content: 31 And the men who went up with him said, “We are not able to go up against the people, because he is stronger than us,”

title: Numbers 13:32
content: 32 and they caused an evil report of the land, it that they had explored, to go out to the sons of Israel, saying, “The land in which we passed through to explore it, it is a land that eats those who dwell in it. And all the people whom we saw in the midst of it were men of size,

title: Numbers 13:33
content: 33 and there we saw the Nephilim, the sons of Anak from the Nephilim, and we were like grasshoppers in our eyes, and so we were in their eyes.”

title: Numbers 14:1
content: 1 And all the congregation lifted up and gave their voice, and the people wept in that night.

title: Numbers 14:2
