content: 2 And all the sons of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron. And all the congregation said to them, “If only we had died in the land of Egypt, or if only we had died in this wilderness!

title: Numbers 14:3
content: 3 And why is Yahweh bringing us to this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and our children will be for plunder. Is it not good for us to return to Egypt?”

title: Numbers 14:4
content: 4 And they said, a man to his brother, “Let us set a head, and let us return to Egypt.”

title: Numbers 14:5
content: 5 And Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before the face of all the assembly of the congregation of the sons of Israel,

title: Numbers 14:6
content: 6 and Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, from the ones who explored the land, tore their garments,

title: Numbers 14:7
content: 7 and they spoke to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, saying, “The land in which we passed through to explore it is a very exceedingly good land.

title: Numbers 14:8
content: 8 If Yahweh delights in us, then he will bring us into this land, and he will give it to us, a land that is flowing with milk and honey.

title: Numbers 14:9
content: 9 Only you shall not rebel against Yahweh, and you shall not fear the people of the land, for they are our food. He has turned their shadow from over them, and Yahweh is with us. You shall not fear them!”

title: Numbers 14:10
content: 10 And all the congregation said to stone them with stones. But the glory of Yahweh appeared in the tent of meeting to all the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 14:11
content: 11 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Until when will this people spurn me? And until when will they not trust in me, despite all the signs that I have done in the midst of them?

title: Numbers 14:12
content: 12 I will strike him down with the plague, and I will disinherit him, and I will make you into a nation greater and more numerous than them.”

title: Numbers 14:13
content: 13 And Moses said to Yahweh, “And the Egyptians have heard that you brought this people up with your power from the midst of him.

title: Numbers 14:14
content: 14 And they have spoken to those dwelling in this land. They have heard that you, Yahweh, are in the midst of this people; that you, Yahweh, have been seen eye by eye, and your cloud is standing over them, and in a column of cloud you are going before their face by day and in a column of fire at night.

title: Numbers 14:15
content: 15 If you kill this people like one man, then the nations will say that they heard a report of you, saying,

title: Numbers 14:16
content: 16 ‘Because Yahweh was not able to bring this people into the land that he swore to them, so he slaughtered them in the wilderness.’

title: Numbers 14:17
content: 17 And now, please let the power of my Lord be great, just as you have spoken, saying,

title: Numbers 14:18
content: 18 ‘Yahweh is long of nostrils and abundant of covenant faithfulness, lifting up iniquity and transgression. But surely he will not leave unpunished, appointing the iniquity of fathers on sons, on thirds, and on fourths.’

title: Numbers 14:19
content: 19 Please forgive this people of the iniquity according to the greatness of your covenant faithfulness, and just as you have lifted up this people, from Egypt and to here.”

title: Numbers 14:20
content: 20 And Yahweh said, “I have forgiven according to your word.

title: Numbers 14:21
content: 21 But truly, I live, and all the earth will be filled with the glory of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 14:22
content: 22 For all the men who have seen my glory and my signs that I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and they tested me this ten times and have not listened to my voice,

title: Numbers 14:23
content: 23 if they see the land that I have sworn to their fathers…and all those who spurn me will not see it.

title: Numbers 14:24
content: 24 But my servant Caleb, because another spirit is with him, and he was fully after me, I will bring him into the land that he will come to there, and his seed will inherit it.

title: Numbers 14:25
content: 25 (And the Amalekite and the Canaanite were dwelling in the valley.) Tomorrow turn and set out for yourselves to the wilderness, the way of the Sea of Reeds.”

title: Numbers 14:26
content: 26 And Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 14:27
content: 27 “Until when must I listen to this evil congregation, they who are murmuring against me the murmurings of the sons of Israel, they who are murmuring against me?

title: Numbers 14:28
content: 28 Say to them, ‘{As} I live,’–the declaration of Yahweh–‘surely just as you have spoken in my ears, so I will do to you:

title: Numbers 14:29
content: 29 In this wilderness your corpses will fall and all your counted ones according to all your number, from a son of 20 years and upward, who have murmured against me.

title: Numbers 14:30
content: 30 If you enter into the land that I have lifted up my hand to make you dwell in … except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun,

title: Numbers 14:31
content: 31 and your children who you said would be for plunder; and I will bring them, and they will know the land, it that you have rejected.

title: Numbers 14:32
content: 32 And you, your corpses will fall in this wilderness,

title: Numbers 14:33
content: 33 and your sons will be those who herd in the wilderness 40 years, and they will carry your fornications until the finishing of your corpses in the wilderness.

title: Numbers 14:34
content: 34 By the number of the days that you explored the land, 40 days, a day for the year, a day for the year, you will carry your iniquities 40 years. And you will know my opposition.

title: Numbers 14:35
content: 35 I, Yahweh, have spoken. Surely I will do this to all this evil congregation, the ones who have congregated themselves against me. In this wilderness they will finish, and there they will die.’”

title: Numbers 14:36
content: 36 And the men whom Moses had sent to explore the land and had returned and caused all the congregation to murmur against him by causing an evil report against the land to go out,

title: Numbers 14:37
content: 37 even the men who had caused to go out the evil report of the evil land, died by the plague before the face of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 14:38
content: 38 But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh lived from those men, the ones who went to explore the land.

title: Numbers 14:39
content: 39 And Moses spoke these words to all the sons of Israel, and the people mourned exceedingly,

title: Numbers 14:40
content: 40 and they rose early in the morning and went up to the head of the mountain, saying, “Here we are, and we will go up to the place that Yahweh has said, for we have sinned.”

title: Numbers 14:41
content: 41 And Moses said, “Why this—are you passing over the mouth of Yahweh? And it will not succeed.

title: Numbers 14:42
content: 42 You shall not go up, because Yahweh is not in the midst of you, that you not be struck down before the face of your enemies.

title: Numbers 14:43
content: 43 For the Amalekite and the Canaanite are there before your face, and you will fall by the sword, for you have turned from after Yahweh, and therefore Yahweh will not be with you.”

title: Numbers 14:44
content: 44 And they presumed to go up to the head of the mountain, but the box of the covenant of Yahweh and Moses did not depart from the midst of the camp.

title: Numbers 14:45
content: 45 And the Amalekite and the Canaanite who dwelled on that mountain, came down. And they smote them and beat them to pieces as far as the Hormah.

title: Numbers 15:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 15:2
content: 2 “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you enter into the land of your dwellings, which I am giving to you,

title: Numbers 15:3
content: 3 then you shall make an offering made by fire to Yahweh, a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to do an extraordinary vow or with a voluntary offering, or at your appointed times, to make an aroma of soothing for Yahweh from the herd or from the flock.

title: Numbers 15:4
content: 4 And the one who is offering shall offer his offering to Yahweh, a grain offering, a tenth of fine flour mixed with a fourth of the hin of oil.

title: Numbers 15:5
content: 5 And wine for the drink offering, a fourth of the hin, you shall make with the burnt offering or for the sacrifice, for the one male lamb.

title: Numbers 15:6
content: 6 Or for the ram you shall make a grain offering, two tenths fine flour mixed with a third of the hin of oil.

title: Numbers 15:7
content: 7 And wine for the drink offering, a third of the hin, you shall offer as an aroma of soothing for Yahweh.

title: Numbers 15:8
content: 8 And when you make a son of cattle a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to do an extraordinary vow or peace offerings to Yahweh,

title: Numbers 15:9
content: 9 then you shall offer with the son of the cattle a grain offering, three tenths fine flour mixed with a half of the hin of the oil,

title: Numbers 15:10
content: 10 and you shall offer a half of the hin of wine for the drink offering, an offering made by fire, an aroma of soothing for Yahweh.

title: Numbers 15:11
content: 11 Thus it shall be done for the one ox or for the one ram or for the small livestock among the male lambs or among the goats.

title: Numbers 15:12
content: 12 According to the number that you do, thus you shall do for the one according to their number.

title: Numbers 15:13
content: 13 Every native shall do these things thus for offering an offering made by fire, an aroma of soothing for Yahweh.

title: Numbers 15:14
content: 14 And if a sojourner sojourns with you, or whoever is in the midst of you for your generations, and he makes an offering made by fire, an aroma of soothing for Yahweh, just as you shall do, so he shall do.

title: Numbers 15:15
content: 15 The assembly statute is one for you and for the sojourner, the one who is sojourning, a statute of eternity for your generations. As you, so the sojourner shall be before the face of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 15:16
content: 16 One instruction and one ordinance shall be for you and for the sojourner, the one who is sojourning with you.’”

title: Numbers 15:17
content: 17 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 15:18
content: 18 “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you enter into the land there to which I am bringing you,

title: Numbers 15:19
content: 19 and it shall be that when you eat from the bread of the land, you shall raise a raised offering to Yahweh.

title: Numbers 15:20
content: 20 The first of your dough shall be a cake you shall raise as a raised offering. Like a raised offering of the threshing floor, so you shall raise it.

title: Numbers 15:21
content: 21 From the first of your dough you shall give a raised offering to Yahweh for your generations.

title: Numbers 15:22
content: 22 And when you stray and do not do all these commandments that Yahweh has spoken to Moses,

title: Numbers 15:23
content: 23 all that Yahweh has commanded to you by the hand of Moses, from the day that Yahweh commanded and beyond for your generations,

title: Numbers 15:24
content: 24 and it shall be that, if it was done as unintentional sin away from the eyes of the congregation, then all the congregation shall make a bull, one son of cattle, for a burnt offering, for an aroma of soothing for Yahweh, and its grain offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one buck of the goats for a sin offering.

title: Numbers 15:25
content: 25 And the priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the sons of Israel, and it shall be forgiven for them, for it was an unintentional sin, and they have brought their offering, an offering made by fire, to Yahweh, and their sin offering before the face of Yahweh for their unintentional sin.

title: Numbers 15:26
content: 26 And it shall be forgiven for all the congregation of the sons of Israel and for the sojourner, the one who is sojourning in the midst of them, because of all the people with unintentional sin.

title: Numbers 15:27
content: 27 And if one person sins with an unintentional sin, then he shall offer a female goat, a daughter of its year, for a sin offering.

title: Numbers 15:28
content: 28 And the priest shall make atonement for the person, the one who sinned unintentionally with a sin, with an unintentional sin, before the face of Yahweh, to make atonement for him, and it shall be forgiven for him.

title: Numbers 15:29
content: 29 The native among the sons of Israel and for the sojourner, the one who is sojourning in the midst of them, one instruction shall be for you for the one who does an unintentional sin.

title: Numbers 15:30
content: 30 But the person who does with a raised hand, from the native and from the sojourner, he is blaspheming Yahweh, and that person shall be cut off from the midst of his people,

title: Numbers 15:31
content: 31 because he has despised the word of Yahweh and has broken his commandment, that person shall certainly be cut off. His iniquity shall be on him.’”

title: Numbers 15:32
content: 32 And the sons of Israel were in the wilderness, and they found a man gathering pieces of wood on the day of the Sabbath,

title: Numbers 15:33
content: 33 and the ones who found him gathering pieces of wood brought him near to Moses and to Aaron and to all the congregation,

title: Numbers 15:34
content: 34 and they made him rest in the keeping place, because it had not been declared what should be done to him.

title: Numbers 15:35
content: 35 And Yahweh said to Moses, “The man shall certainly die, all the congregation stoning him with the stones from the outside of the camp.”

title: Numbers 15:36
content: 36 And all the congregation brought him out to the outside of the camp, and they stoned him with the stones and he died, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

title: Numbers 15:37
content: 37 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 15:38
content: 38 “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘And they shall make for themselves a tassel on the wings of their garments for their generations, and they shall put a cord of blue on the tassel of the wing,

title: Numbers 15:39
content: 39 and it shall be for you for a tassel, and you shall see it, and you shall remember all the commandments of Yahweh, and you shall do them. And you shall not explore after your heart and after your eyes, them which you are prostituting after,

title: Numbers 15:40
content: 40 so that you shall remember and do all my commandments. And you shall be holy ones for your God.

title: Numbers 15:41
content: 41 I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out from the land of Egypt, to become a God for you. I am Yahweh your God.”

title: Numbers 16:1
content: 1 And Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, the sons of Reuben, took men,

title: Numbers 16:2
content: 2 and they rose up before the face of Moses with men from the sons of Israel, 250 leaders of the congregation, the called ones of the appointed meeting, men of name,

title: Numbers 16:3
content: 3 and they assembled against Moses and against Aaron. And they said to them, “It is much for you! For all of the congregation, all of them, are holy and Yahweh is in their midst. And why do you lift up yourselves above the assembly of Yahweh?”

title: Numbers 16:4
content: 4 And Moses heard and fell on his face.

title: Numbers 16:5
content: 5 And he spoke to Korah and to all his congregation, saying, “And in the morning Yahweh will make known who belongs to him and is the holy one and whom he will bring near to him. And him whom he chooses he will bring near to him.

title: Numbers 16:6
content: 6 Do this: Korah and all his congregation, take for yourselves censers,

title: Numbers 16:7
content: 7 and put fire in them, and set incense on them before the face of Yahweh tomorrow. And it will happen that the man whom Yahweh chooses, he will be the holy one. It is much for you, sons of Levi!”

title: Numbers 16:8
content: 8 And Moses said to Korah, “Now listen, sons of Levi:

title: Numbers 16:9
content: 9 Is it a small thing for you that the God of Israel has separated you from the congregation of Israel to bring you near to him to serve the service of the Dwelling of Yahweh and to stand before the face of the congregation to minister to them?

title: Numbers 16:10
content: 10 And he has brought you near, and all your brothers, the sons of Levi, with you. And you are seeking the priesthood also!

title: Numbers 16:11
content: 11 Therefore, you and all your congregation are the ones congregating against Yahweh, and Aaron, what is he that you grumble against him?”

title: Numbers 16:12
content: 12 And Moses sent to call for Dathan and for Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and they said, “We will not go up.

title: Numbers 16:13
content: 13 Is it a small thing that you have brought us up from a land flowing with milk and honey to make us die in the wilderness? But you have made yourself ruler over us, even to make yourself ruler!

title: Numbers 16:14
content: 14 Moreover, you have not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, or given to us an inheritance of field or vineyard. Will you gouge out the eyes of these men? We will not go up.”

title: Numbers 16:15
content: 15 And it burned exceedingly for Moses, and he said to Yahweh, “Do not turn to their offering. I have not taken one donkey from them. And I have not harmed one of them.”

title: Numbers 16:16
content: 16 And Moses said to Korah, “You and all your congregation be before the face of Yahweh, you and they and Aaron, tomorrow,

title: Numbers 16:17
content: 17 and take a man his censer, and put incense on them, and bring before the face of Yahweh, a man his censer, 250 censers, and you and Aaron, a man his censer.”

title: Numbers 16:18
content: 18 And they took a man his censer, and they put fire on it and set incense on it, and they stood at the opening of the tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron.

title: Numbers 16:19
content: 19 And Korah assembled all the congregation against them at the opening of the tent of meeting, and the glory of Yahweh appeared to all the congregation.

title: Numbers 16:20
content: 20 And Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 16:21
content: 21 “Separate yourselves from the midst of this congregation, and I shall finish them in a moment.”

title: Numbers 16:22
content: 22 And they fell on their faces and said, “God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, will one man sin and you become furious against all the congregation?”

title: Numbers 16:23
content: 23 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 16:24
content: 24 “Speak to the congregation, saying, ‘Get yourselves up from around the dwellings of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.’”

title: Numbers 16:25
content: 25 And Moses rose and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel went after him.

title: Numbers 16:26
content: 26 And he spoke to the congregation, saying, “Now turn from beside the tents of these wicked men and do not touch anything that belongs to them, lest you be swept away by all their sins.”

title: Numbers 16:27
content: 27 And they got themselves up from beside the dwelling of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, from all around, and Dathan and Abiram went out, standing at the opening of their tents with their wives and their sons and their little children.

title: Numbers 16:28
content: 28 And Moses said, “By this you will know that Yahweh has sent me to do all these deeds, that they are not from my heart:

title: Numbers 16:29
content: 29 If these ones die like the death of every man and the appointment of every man is appointed to them, Yahweh has not sent me.

title: Numbers 16:30
content: 30 But if Yahweh creates a creation and the ground opens its mouth and swallows them and all that belongs to them and they go down alive to Sheol, then you will know that these men have spurned Yahweh.”

title: Numbers 16:31
content: 31 And it happened when he finished speaking all these words that the ground that was under them split open.

title: Numbers 16:32
content: 32 And the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them and their houses and every man who belonged to Korah and all the property.

title: Numbers 16:33
content: 33 And they went down to Sheol alive, they and all that belonged to them, and the earth covered over them and they perished from the midst of the assembly.

title: Numbers 16:34
content: 34 And all Israel who was surrounding them fled from their sound, for they said, “Lest the earth swallow us!”

title: Numbers 16:35
content: 35 And fire went out from with Yahweh, and it ate the 250 men offering the incense.

title: Numbers 16:36
content: 36 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 16:37
content: 37 “Say to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, and he shall lift up the censers from between the burning and scatter the fire abroad, for they are holy.

title: Numbers 16:38
content: 38 And the censers of these sinners against their lives, make them hammered sheets of thin metal, plating for the altar. For they offered them before the face of Yahweh, and they are holy, and they shall be for a sign for the sons of Israel.”

title: Numbers 16:39
content: 39 And Eleazar the priest took the censers of bronze that the burned ones had offered, and they hammered them as a plating for the altar,

title: Numbers 16:40
content: 40 a reminder for the sons of Israel, so that an unfamiliar man, he who is not from the seed of Aaron, shall not come near to burn incense before the face of Yahweh, and he shall not be like Korah and his congregation, just as Yahweh spoke by the hand of Moses to him.

title: Numbers 16:41
content: 41 And all the congregation of the sons of Israel grumbled against Moses and against Aaron from the next day, saying, “You yourselves killed the people of Yahweh!”

title: Numbers 16:42
content: 42 And it happened when the congregation assembled against Moses and against Aaron that they turned to the tent of meeting, and behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of Yahweh was seen.

title: Numbers 16:43
content: 43 And Moses and Aaron came to the face of the tent of meeting,

title: Numbers 16:44
content: 44 and Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 16:45
content: 45 “Get yourselves up from the midst of this congregation, and I shall finish them in a moment,” and they fell on their faces.

title: Numbers 16:46
content: 46 And Moses said to Aaron, “Take the censer, and put fire on it from on the altar, and set incense, and go quickly into the congregation, and make atonement for them, because the wrath has gone out from before the face of Yahweh. The plague has begun.”

title: Numbers 16:47
content: 47 And Aaron took just as Moses said and ran into the midst of the assembly. And behold, the plague had begun among the people. And he put the incense and made atonement for the people.

title: Numbers 16:48
content: 48 And he stood between the ones who died and the ones who lived. And the plague was stopped.

title: Numbers 16:49
content: 49 And the ones who died by the plague were 14, 700, apart from the ones who died on account of the matter of Korah.

title: Numbers 16:50
content: 50 And Aaron returned to Moses, to the opening of the tent of meeting, and the plague was stopped.

title: Numbers 17:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 17:2
content: 2 “Speak to the sons of Israel, and take a staff from with them, a staff for the house of a father, from with all their leaders for the house of their fathers, 12 staffs. You shall write a man his name on his staff,

title: Numbers 17:3
content: 3 and you shall write the name of Aaron on the staff of Levi; for one staff is for the head of the house of their fathers,

title: Numbers 17:4
content: 4 and you shall rest them in the tent of meeting, before the face of the testimony, there where I meet with you.

title: Numbers 17:5
content: 5 And it will happen that the man, him whom I choose, his staff will bud. And I will make the grumblings of the sons of Israel that they are grumbling against you cease from against me.”

title: Numbers 17:6
content: 6 And Moses spoke to the sons of Israel, and all their leaders gave to him a staff for one leader, a staff for one leader, for the house of their fathers, 12 staffs, and the staff of Aaron was in the midst of their staffs;

title: Numbers 17:7
content: 7 and Moses rested the staffs before the face of Yahweh in the tent of testimony.

title: Numbers 17:8
content: 8 And it happened from the next day that Moses came into the tent of the testimony, and behold, the staff of Aaron for the house of Levi had budded, and it brought out a bud, and it blossomed a flower, and it ripened almonds!

title: Numbers 17:9
content: 9 And Moses brought out all the staffs from before the face of Yahweh to all the sons of Israel. And they saw and took, a man his staff.

title: Numbers 17:10
content: 10 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Return the staff of Aaron to the face of the testimony for keeping for a sign for the sons of rebellion, and you shall end their grumblings from against me, and they shall not die.”

title: Numbers 17:11
content: 11 And Moses did just as Yahweh had commanded him, thus he did.

title: Numbers 17:12
content: 12 And the sons of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, “Look, we will expire! We will perish! All of us will perish!

title: Numbers 17:13
content: 13 All who come near, who come near to the Dwelling of Yahweh die. Will we be finished by expiring?”

title: Numbers 18:1
content: 1 And Yahweh said to Aaron, “You and your sons and the house of your father with you shall bear the iniquity of the holy place; and you and your sons with you shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.

title: Numbers 18:2
content: 2 And also bring with you your brothers, the staff of Levi, the tribe of your father, and they shall be joined to you and serve you; and you and your sons with you shall be before the face of the tent of the testimony.

title: Numbers 18:3
content: 3 And they shall keep your keeping and the keeping of all of the tent. However, they shall not come near to the vessels of the holy place or to the altar, and they will not die, both them and you.

title: Numbers 18:4
content: 4 And they shall be joined to you and shall keep the keeping of the tent of meeting, for all the service of the tent; and a stranger shall not come near to you;

title: Numbers 18:5
content: 5 and you shall keep the keeping of the holy place and the keeping of the altar, and there shall not again be fury against the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 18:6
content: 6 And I, behold, I have taken your brothers the Levites from the midst of the sons of Israel as a gift for you, ones given to Yahweh to serve the service of the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 18:7
content: 7 And you and your sons with you shall keep your priesthood for all the things of the altar and for the inside of the curtain, and you shall serve. I have given your priesthood as a gift of service, and a stranger who comes near shall be put to death.”

title: Numbers 18:8
content: 8 And Yahweh spoke to Aaron, “And I, behold, I have given to you the keeping of my contribution, of all the holy things of the sons of Israel I have given them to you for a portion and to your sons for a statute of eternity.

title: Numbers 18:9
content: 9 This will belong to you from the holiest holy thing from the fire: every offering of theirs, of every grain offering of theirs and of every sin offering of theirs and of every guilt offering of theirs which they return to me, a holiest holy thing it is for you and for your sons.

title: Numbers 18:10
content: 10 You shall eat it as a holiest holy thing. Every male shall eat it. It is holy for you.

title: Numbers 18:11
content: 11 And this belongs to you: the contribution of their gift, of all the wave offerings of the sons of Israel, I have given them to you and to your sons and to your daughters with you for a statute of eternity. Every clean one in your house shall eat it.

title: Numbers 18:12
content: 12 All the fat of fresh oil and all the fat of new wine and grain, their firstfruits which they will give to Yahweh, I have given them to you.

title: Numbers 18:13
content: 13 The firstfruits of all that is in the land which they will bring to Yahweh will belong to you. Every clean one in your house shall eat it.

title: Numbers 18:14
content: 14 Every dedicated thing in Israel will belong to you.

title: Numbers 18:15
content: 15 Every opener of the womb of all flesh that they offer to Yahweh, among mankind and among livestock, will belong to you. But you shall surely redeem the firstborn of mankind, and you shall redeem the firstborn of the unclean livestock.

title: Numbers 18:16
content: 16 And his redeemed ones from a son of a month you shall redeem by your valuation, five silver shekels by the shekel of the holy place (it is 20 gerahs).

title: Numbers 18:17
content: 17 But the firstborn of a cow or the firstborn of a sheep or the firstborn of a goat you shall not redeem; they are holy. You shall throw their blood on the altar, and you shall make their fat smoke as an offering made by fire for an aroma of soothing for Yahweh.

title: Numbers 18:18
content: 18 And their flesh will belong to you; like the breast of the wave offering or like the right thigh, it will belong to you.

title: Numbers 18:19
content: 19 All the contributions of the holy things which the sons of Israel lift up to Yahweh, I have given to you and to your sons and to your daughters with you for a statute of eternity. It is an eternal covenant of salt before the face of Yahweh for you and for your seed with you.”

title: Numbers 18:20
content: 20 And Yahweh said to Aaron, “You shall not inherit in their land and a portion in their midst shall not belong to you. I am your portion and your inheritance in the midst of the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 18:21
content: 21 And to the sons of Levi, behold, I have given every tenth in Israel for an inheritance in exchange for their service which they are serving, the service of the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 18:22
content: 22 And the sons of Israel shall not again come near to the tent of meeting to bear sin to die.

title: Numbers 18:23
content: 23 And the Levite, he shall serve the service of the tent of meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity. It is a statute of eternity for your generations, and in the midst of the sons of Israel you shall not inherit an inheritance.

title: Numbers 18:24
content: 24 For I have given to the Levites for an inheritance the tenth of the sons of Israel which they lift up to Yahweh as a contribution. Therefore, I have said to them, ‘You shall not inherit an inheritance in the midst of the sons of Israel.’”

title: Numbers 18:25
content: 25 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 18:26
content: 26 “And speak to the Levites and say to them, ‘When you take from with the sons of Israel the tenth that I have given to you from with them as your inheritance, then you shall lift up from it a contribution of Yahweh, a tenth from the tenth.

title: Numbers 18:27
content: 27 And it shall be reckoned to you as your contribution like the grain from the threshing floor and like the fullness from the winepress.

title: Numbers 18:28
content: 28 Thus you shall lift up, also you, the contribution of Yahweh from all your tenths which you took from with the sons of Israel, and you shall give from it the contribution of Yahweh to Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers 18:29
content: 29 From all your gifts you shall lift up all of the contribution of Yahweh, from all its fat, its holy part from it.’

title: Numbers 18:30
content: 30 And you shall say to them, ‘When you lift up its fat from it, then it shall be reckoned to the Levites like the product of the threshing floor and like the product of the winepress.

title: Numbers 18:31
content: 31 And you shall eat it in every place, you and your house, because it is a wage for you in exchange for your service in the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 18:32
content: 32 And you shall not bear sin on account of it when you lift up its fat from it, and the holy things of the sons of Israel you shall not defile, and not die.’”

title: Numbers 19:1
content: 1 And Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

title: Numbers 19:2
content: 2 “This is the statute of the law which Yahweh has commanded, saying, ‘Speak to the sons of Israel and they shall bring to you an unblemished red heifer in which there is no defect, on which a yoke has not gone up.

title: Numbers 19:3
content: 3 And you shall give it to Eleazar the priest. And he shall bring it out to the outside of the camp and shall slaughter it before his face.

title: Numbers 19:4
content: 4 And Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger and shall sprinkle some of its blood to opposite the face of the tent of meeting seven times.

title: Numbers 19:5
content: 5 And he shall burn the heifer before his eyes. He shall burn its skin and its flesh, and its blood with its dung.

title: Numbers 19:6
content: 6 And the priest shall take wood of cedar and hyssop and scarlet material of a worm, and throw into the midst of the burning of the heifer.

title: Numbers 19:7
content: 7 And the priest shall wash his garments and bathe his flesh in the water, and afterward he shall enter into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the evening.

title: Numbers 19:8
content: 8 And the one who burned it shall wash his garments in the water and bathe his flesh in the water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.

title: Numbers 19:9
content: 9 And a clean man shall gather the ashes of the heifer and rest them in a clean place outside of the camp, and it shall be for the congregation of the sons of Israel to keep for the water of purification; it is a sin offering.

title: Numbers 19:10
content: 10 And the one who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his garments and be unclean until the evening. And it shall be for the sons of Israel and for the sojourner who sojourns in their midst for a statute of eternity.

title: Numbers 19:11
content: 11 The one who touches a dead body of any human life will be unclean seven days.

title: Numbers 19:12
content: 12 He shall purify himself with it on the third day, and on the seventh day he will be clean, and if he does not purify himself on the third day, then on the seventh day he will not be clean.

title: Numbers 19:13
content: 13 Every one who touches a dead body, a human person who has died, and does not purify himself, makes the Dwelling of Yahweh unclean, and that person shall be cut off from Israel. Because the water of purification was not sprinkled on him, he will be unclean; his uncleanness is still on him.

title: Numbers 19:14
content: 14 This is the law of a man who dies in a tent: Every one who enters into the tent and everyone who is in the tent will be unclean seven days,

title: Numbers 19:15
content: 15 and every opened vessel on which there is no fastened cover, it is unclean.

title: Numbers 19:16
content: 16 And all who touch one pierced of the sword or a dead body or a bone of a human or a grave on the face of the field will be unclean seven days.

title: Numbers 19:17
content: 17 And they shall take for the unclean one some of the ashes of the burning of the sin offering, and he shall put living water with it into a vessel,

title: Numbers 19:18
content: 18 and a clean man shall take and dip hyssop in the water. And he shall sprinkle on the tent and on all the vessels and on the lives who were there and on the one who touched the bone or the pierced one or the dead body or the grave,

title: Numbers 19:19
content: 19 and the clean one shall sprinkle on the unclean one on the third day and on the seventh day, and he shall purify him on the seventh day. And he shall wash his garments and bathe in the water, and he will be unclean until the evening.

title: Numbers 19:20
content: 20 And a man who is unclean and does not purify himself, that person shall be cut off from the midst of the assembly because he has made the holy place of Yahweh unclean. He has not thrown on himself the water of purification. He is unclean.

title: Numbers 19:21
content: 21 And it shall be for them for a statute of eternity, and the one who sprinkles the water of purification shall wash his garments, and the one who touches the water of purification will be unclean until the evening,

title: Numbers 19:22
content: 22 and all who touch him, the unclean one, will be unclean; and the person who touches will be unclean until the evening.”

title: Numbers 20:1
content: 1 And the sons of Israel, all the congregation, entered the wilderness of Zin in the first month, and the people stayed at Kadesh, and Miriam died there and was buried there.

title: Numbers 20:2
content: 2 And there was no water for the congregation, and they assembled against Moses and against Aaron.

title: Numbers 20:3
content: 3 And the people quarreled with Moses, and spoke, saying, “If only we had expired when our brothers expired before the face of Yahweh!

title: Numbers 20:4
content: 4 And why have you brought the assembly of Yahweh into this wilderness to die here, we and our livestock?

title: Numbers 20:5
content: 5 And why did you bring us up from Egypt to bring us into this evil place? It is not a place of seed or fig free or vine or pomegranate tree, and there is no water to drink!”

title: Numbers 20:6
content: 6 And Moses and Aaron went from the face of the assembly to the opening of the tent of meeting, and they fell on their faces and the glory of Yahweh appeared to them.

title: Numbers 20:7
content: 7 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 20:8
content: 8 “Take the staff and assemble the congregation, you and Aaron your brother, and you shall speak to the rock before their eyes, and it will give its water; and you shall bring out water to them from the rock, and you shall have the congregation and their livestock drink.”

title: Numbers 20:9
content: 9 And Moses took the staff from before the face of Yahweh, just as he had commanded him.

title: Numbers 20:10
content: 10 And Moses and Aaron assembled the assembly at the face of the rock, and he said to them, “Listen now, the rebellious ones, shall we bring out from this rock water for you?”

title: Numbers 20:11
content: 11 And Moses lifted up his hand and struck the rock with his staff twice, and abundant water came out, and the congregation and their livestock drank.

title: Numbers 20:12
content: 12 And Yahweh said to Moses and to Aaron, “Because you did not trust in me to regard me as holy before the eyes of the sons of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land that I have given to them.”

title: Numbers 20:13
content: 13 These are the waters of Meribah, where the sons of Israel quarreled with Yahweh, and he showed himself holy among them.

title: Numbers 20:14
content: 14 And Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom, “Thus says your brother Israel: you yourself know all the hardship that we found,

title: Numbers 20:15
content: 15 and our fathers went down to Egypt, and we dwelled in Egypt many days, and the Egyptians did evil to us and to our fathers.

title: Numbers 20:16
content: 16 And we cried out to Yahweh, and he heard our voice and sent a messenger and brought us out from Egypt; and behold, we are in Kadesh, the city of the end of your border.

title: Numbers 20:17
content: 17 Please let us pass through your land. We will not pass through field or vineyard, and will we not drink the water of a well. We will go on the road of the king. We will not turn right or left until we have passed through your border.”

title: Numbers 20:18
content: 18 And Edom said to him, “You may not pass through me, lest I go out to meet you with the sword.”

title: Numbers 20:19
content: 19 And the sons of Israel said to him, “We will go on the highway. And if we drink your water, me or my livestock, then we will give their value. Only, there is no matter, let me pass through with my feet.”

title: Numbers 20:20
content: 20 And he said, “You may not pass through.” And Edom came out to meet him with a heavy people and a strong hand.

title: Numbers 20:21
content: 21 And Edom refused to give Israel passage through his territory. And Israel turned from near him.

title: Numbers 20:22
content: 22 And the sons of Israel, all the congregation, set out from Kadesh and came to Mount Hor.

title: Numbers 20:23
content: 23 And Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron at Mount Hor, near the border of the land of Edom, saying,

title: Numbers 20:24
content: 24 “Aaron will be gathered to his people, because he will not enter into the land that I have given to the sons of Israel, because you rebelled against my mouth before the waters of Meribah.

title: Numbers 20:25
content: 25 Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up Mount Hor,

title: Numbers 20:26
content: 26 and strip Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son, and Aaron shall be gathered and die there.”

title: Numbers 20:27
content: 27 And Moses did just as Yahweh had commanded; and they went up to Mount Hor before the eyes of all the congregation,

title: Numbers 20:28
content: 28 and Moses stripped Aaron of his garments and put them on Eleazar his son, and Aaron died there on the head of the mountain, and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.

title: Numbers 20:29
content: 29 And all the congregation saw that Aaron had expired, and all the house of Israel bewailed Aaron 30 days.

title: Numbers 21:1
content: 1 And the Canaanite king of Arad, who dwelled in the Negev, heard that Israel had come by the road of the Atharim, and he fought against Israel and took captive some of them as captives.

title: Numbers 21:2
content: 2 And Israel vowed a vow to Yahweh and said, “If you surely give this people into my hand, then I will dedicate their cities by ban.”

title: Numbers 21:3
content: 3 And Yahweh listened to the voice of Israel and gave the Canaanites, and he dedicated them and their cities by ban, and he called the name of the place Hormah.

title: Numbers 21:4
content: 4 And they set out from Mount Hor by the road of the Sea of Reeds to go around the land of Edom. And the soul of the people was short on the road,

title: Numbers 21:5
content: 5 and the people spoke against God and against Moses: “Why did you bring us up from Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no bread, and there is no water, and our soul detests the worthless bread.”

title: Numbers 21:6
content: 6 And Yahweh sent snakes, fiery ones, among the people and they bit the people, and many people from Israel died.

title: Numbers 21:7
content: 7 And the people came to Moses and said, “We have sinned because we have spoken against Yahweh and against you. Pray to Yahweh and may he remove from on us the snake,” and Moses prayed on behalf of the people.

title: Numbers 21:8
content: 8 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Make for yourself a snake and set it on a pole, and it will happen that any of the bitten will see it and live.”

title: Numbers 21:9
content: 9 And Moses made a snake of bronze, and he set it on the pole. And it happened that if the snake bit a man, then he looked to the snake of bronze, and he lived.

title: Numbers 21:10
content: 10 And the sons of Israel set out and camped at Oboth.

title: Numbers 21:11
content: 11 And they set out from Oboth and camped at Iye Abarim in the wilderness that is on the face of Moab from the rising of the sun.

title: Numbers 21:12
content: 12 From there they set out and camped at the wadi of Zered.

title: Numbers 21:13
content: 13 From there they set out and camped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness that goes out from the border of the Amorite, because the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorite.

title: Numbers 21:14
content: 14 Therefore, it says in the book of the Wars of Yahweh, “… Waheb in Suphah, and the wadis of the Arnon,

title: Numbers 21:15
content: 15 and the slope of the wadis that spreads out to the dwelling of Ar and it leans to the border of Moab,”

title: Numbers 21:16
content: 16 and from there to Beer. It is the well where Yahweh said to Moses, “Gather the people, and I will give water to them.”

title: Numbers 21:17
content: 17 Then Israel sang this song: “Rise up, well! Sing for it,

title: Numbers 21:18
content: 18 the well leaders dug, the noblemen of the people dug it, with a decreer’s staff and their staffs.” And from the wilderness to Mattanah

title: Numbers 21:19
content: 19 and from Mattanah to Nahaliel and from Nahaliel to Bamoth

title: Numbers 21:20
content: 20 and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the field of Moab, the head of the Pisgah, and is looking down on the face of the wasteland.

title: Numbers 21:21
content: 21 And Israel sent messengers to Sihon the king of the Amorite, saying,

title: Numbers 21:22
content: 22 “Let us pass through your land. We will not turn into a field or into a vineyard. We will not drink the water of a well. We will go by the road of the king until we have passed through your border.”

title: Numbers 21:23
content: 23 And Sihon did not give Israel passage through his boundary, and Sihon gathered all his people and went out to the wilderness to meet Israel, and he came to Jahaz and fought with Israel.

title: Numbers 21:24
content: 24 And Israel struck him by the mouth of the sword and took possession of his land from the Arnon as far as the Jabbok, as far as the sons of Ammon, because the border of the sons of Ammon was fortified.

title: Numbers 21:25
content: 25 And Israel took all these cities, and Israel dwelled in all the cities of the Amorite in Heshbon and in all its daughters.

title: Numbers 21:26
content: 26 For Heshbon, it was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorite, and he had fought with the previous king of Moab and had taken all his land from his hand as far as the Arnon.

title: Numbers 21:27
content: 27 Therefore the speakers of proverbs say, “Come to Heshbon. Let the city of Sihon be built and established.

title: Numbers 21:28
content: 28 For fire went out from Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon. It ate Ar of Moab, the lords of the high places of Arnon.

title: Numbers 21:29
content: 29 Woe to you, Moab! You have perished, people of Chemosh. He has given his sons to be escapees and his daughters into the captivity of Sihon the king of the Amorites.

title: Numbers 21:30
content: 30 And we have shot them. Heshbon has perished as far as Dibon. And we have made devastation as far as Nophah, which is as far as Medeba.”

title: Numbers 21:31
content: 31 And Israel dwelled in the land of the Amorites,

title: Numbers 21:32
content: 32 and Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured her daughters, and they dispossessed the Amorites who were there.

title: Numbers 21:33
content: 33 And they turned and went up the road of the Bashan. And Og the king of the Bashan went out to meet them, he and all his people, to the battle at Edrei.

title: Numbers 21:34
content: 34 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Do not fear him, because I have given into your hand him and all his people and his land, and you shall do to him just as you did to Sihon the king of the Amorite, who dwelled in Heshbon.”

title: Numbers 21:35
content: 35 And they struck him and his sons and all his people until they had left no survivor for him, and they took possession of his land.

title: Numbers 22:1
content: 1 And the sons of Israel set out and camped in the plains of Moab, from the other side of the Jordan at Jericho.

title: Numbers 22:2
content: 2 And Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorite.

title: Numbers 22:3
content: 3 And Moab was extremely terrified because of the face of the people, because they were numerous. And Moab was sick with terror because of the face of the sons of Israel,

title: Numbers 22:4
content: 4 and Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now the assembly will lick up all that is around us like an ox licks up the green of the field.” And Balak the son of Zippor was the king of Moab at that time,

title: Numbers 22:5
content: 5 and he sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor at Pethor, which is near the River, the land of the sons of his people, to summon him, saying, “Behold, a people went out from Egypt. Behold, he has covered the eye of the land, and he is dwelling opposite me.

title: Numbers 22:6
content: 6 And now please go curse this people for me because they are more numerous than I. Perhaps I will be able to strike them and drive them out from the land. For I know whom you bless will be blessed, and whom you curse will be cursed.”

title: Numbers 22:7
content: 7 And the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian went, and divination fees were in their hand, and they came to Balaam and spoke to him the words of Balak.

title: Numbers 22:8
content: 8 And he said to them, “Lodge here tonight, and I will bring you back a word, just as Yahweh speaks to me,” and the leaders of Moab stayed with Balaam.

title: Numbers 22:9
content: 9 And God came to Balaam and said, “Who are these men with you?”

title: Numbers 22:10
content: 10 And Balaam said to God, “Balak the son of Zippor, the king of Moab, has sent to me.

title: Numbers 22:11
content: 11 ‘Behold, the people who have come out from Egypt and have covered the eye of the land! Now go curse them for me. Perhaps I will be able to fight them and drive them out.’”

title: Numbers 22:12
content: 12 And God said to Balaam, “You shall not go with them. You shall not curse the people, because they are blessed.”

title: Numbers 22:13
content: 13 And Balaam rose in the morning and said to the leaders of Balak, “Go to your land, because Yahweh has refused to grant me to go with you.”

title: Numbers 22:14
content: 14 And the leaders of Moab rose and came to Balak, and they said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”

title: Numbers 22:15
content: 15 And Balak added again and sent many leaders, and they were more honored than these.

title: Numbers 22:16
content: 16 And they came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, ‘Please do not refrain from coming to me,

title: Numbers 22:17
content: 17 for I will very greatly honor you, and I will do all that you say to me. And please go curse this people for me.’”

title: Numbers 22:18
content: 18 And Balaam answered and said to the servants of Balak, “If Balak gives to me his house full of silver and gold, I will not be able to go beyond the mouth of Yahweh my God to do small or big.

title: Numbers 22:19
content: 19 And now, you also please stay in this place tonight; and may I know what Yahweh will add to speak with me.”

title: Numbers 22:20
content: 20 And God came to Balaam at night and said to him, “If the men have come to summon you, rise and go with them, and only the word that I speak to you, it you shall do.”

title: Numbers 22:21
content: 21 And Balaam rose in the morning and saddled his female donkey and went with the leaders of Moab.

title: Numbers 22:22
content: 22 And the nose of God burned because he was going; and the angel of Yahweh stationed himself in the road as an adversary to him, and he was riding on his female donkey, and two of his servants were with him.

title: Numbers 22:23
content: 23 And the female donkey saw the angel of Yahweh stationed in the road, and his drawn sword was in his hand, and the female donkey turned aside from the road and went in the field. And Balaam struck the female donkey to turn her to the road.

title: Numbers 22:24
content: 24 And the angel of Yahweh stood in the narrow pass of the vineyards, a wall on this side and a wall on that side.

title: Numbers 22:25
content: 25 And the female donkey saw the angel of Yahweh, and she pressed herself to the wall, and she pressed the foot of Balaam to the wall. And he struck her again.

title: Numbers 22:26
content: 26 And the angel of Yahweh passed on again and stood in a narrow place where there was no road to turn right or left.

title: Numbers 22:27
content: 27 And the female donkey saw the angel of Yahweh and lay down under Balaam, and the nose of Balaam burned, and he struck the female donkey with the staff.

title: Numbers 22:28
content: 28 And Yahweh opened the mouth of the female donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you that you struck me these three times?”

title: Numbers 22:29
content: 29 And Balaam said to the female donkey, “Because you acted mockingly with me! If only there was a sword in my hand! Surely I would slay you!”

title: Numbers 22:30
content: 30 And the female donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your female donkey on which you have ridden from your continuance until this day? Have I ever been accustomed to doing thus to you?” And he said, “No.”

title: Numbers 22:31
content: 31 And Yahweh uncovered the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of Yahweh stationed in the road and his drawn sword in his hand. And he bowed and bowed down his nose.

title: Numbers 22:32
content: 32 And the angel of Yahweh said to him, “On account of what have you struck your female donkey these three times? Behold, I myself have gone out as an adversary because your way has been perverse in front of me.

title: Numbers 22:33
content: 33 And the female donkey saw me and turned aside before my face these three times. If she had not turned aside from me, surely now even you I would have slain and kept her alive.”

title: Numbers 22:34
content: 34 And Balaam said to the angel of Yahweh, “I have sinned, for I did not know that you were stationed to meet me in the road. And now, if it is evil in your eyes, I will return to me.”

title: Numbers 22:35
content: 35 And the angel of Yahweh said to Balaam, “Go with the men, and only the word that I speak to you, it you shall speak.” And Balaam went with the leaders of Balak.

title: Numbers 22:36
content: 36 And Balak heard that Balaam had come, and he went out to meet him at a city of Moab, that is near the border of the Arnon, which is at the end of the border.

title: Numbers 22:37
content: 37 And Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not indeed send to you to summon you? Why did you not come to me? Am I truly not able to honor you?”

title: Numbers 22:38
content: 38 And Balaam said to Balak, “Behold, I have come to you. Am I now at all able to speak anything? The word that God puts in my mouth, it will I speak.”

title: Numbers 22:39
content: 39 And Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath Huzoth,

title: Numbers 22:40
content: 40 and Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep and sent to Balaam and to the leaders who were with him.

title: Numbers 22:41
content: 41 And it happened in the morning that Balak took Balaam and brought him up to the high place of Baal, and from there he saw the edge of the people.

title: Numbers 23:1
content: 1 And Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me in this place seven altars, and prepare for me in this place seven bulls and seven rams.”

title: Numbers 23:2
content: 2 And Balak did just as Balaam had said, and Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on the altar.

title: Numbers 23:3
content: 3 And Balaam said to Balak, “Station yourself beside your burnt offering, and I will go. Perhaps Yahweh will be met to meet me, and I will declare to you the word of what he shows me.” And he went to a bare high place.

title: Numbers 23:4
content: 4 And God met with Balaam, and he said to him, “I have arranged seven altars and offered up a bull and a ram on the altar.”

title: Numbers 23:5
content: 5 And Yahweh put a word in the mouth of Balaam and said, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”

title: Numbers 23:6
content: 6 And he returned to him, and behold, he was stationed beside his burnt offering, he and all the leaders of Moab.

title: Numbers 23:7
content: 7 And he lifted up his oracle and said, “Balak has led me from Aram, the king of Moab from the mountains of the east. ‘Go curse Jacob for me, and go denounce Israel.’

title: Numbers 23:8
content: 8 How can I curse? God has not cursed. And how can I denounce? Yahweh has not denounced.

title: Numbers 23:9
content: 9 For from the head of the rocks I see him. And from the hills I look at him. Behold, the people dwells by itself and it does not reckon itself among the nations.

title: Numbers 23:10
content: 10 Who can count the dust of Jacob or number the fourth part of Israel? Let my life die the death of the upright ones, and let my end be like his!”

title: Numbers 23:11
content: 11 And Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and behold, you have blessed indeed!”

title: Numbers 23:12
content: 12 And he answered and said, “Should I not be careful to speak it that Yahweh puts in my mouth?”

title: Numbers 23:13
content: 13 And Balak said to him, “Please go with me to another place from which you can see him. You will only see his edge, and you will not see all of him, and you will curse him for me from there.”

title: Numbers 23:14
content: 14 And he took him to the field of Zophim, to the head of the Pisgah, and he built seven altars and offered up a bull and a ram on the altar.

title: Numbers 23:15
content: 15 Then he said to Balak, “Station yourself here beside your burnt offering, and I will be met with there.”

title: Numbers 23:16
content: 16 And Yahweh met with Balaam and put a word in his mouth, and he said, “Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”

title: Numbers 23:17
content: 17 And he came to him, and behold, he was stationed beside his altar, and the leaders of Moab were with him; and Balak said to him, “What did Yahweh speak?”

title: Numbers 23:18
content: 18 And he lifted up his oracle and said, “Rise up, Balak, and listen. Give ear to me, son of Zippor.

title: Numbers 23:19
content: 19 God is not a man, that he would lie, Or a son of mankind, that he would change his mind. Has he said and not done, Or spoken and not made it arise?

title: Numbers 23:20
content: 20 Behold, I have received to bless. And he has blessed, and I cannot turn it back.

title: Numbers 23:21
content: 21 He has not looked at hardship in Jacob and he has not seen trouble in Israel. Yahweh his God is with him, and the shout of the king is with him.

title: Numbers 23:22
content: 22 God is bringing them out from Egypt like the horns of a wild ox for him.

title: Numbers 23:23
content: 23 For there is no omen against Jacob, and no divination against Israel. At this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, ‘What God has done!’

title: Numbers 23:24
content: 24 Look, a people rises like a lioness, and like a lion he lifts himself up. He will not lie down until he eats prey and drinks the blood of the pierced ones.”

title: Numbers 23:25
content: 25 And Balak said to Balaam, “Even do not curse him at all! Also, do not bless him at all!”

title: Numbers 23:26
content: 26 And Balaam answered and said to Balak, “Did I not speak to you, saying, ‘All that Yahweh speaks, it I must do?’”

title: Numbers 23:27
content: 27 And Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place. Perhaps it will be right in the eyes of God, and you will curse him for me from there.”

title: Numbers 23:28
content: 28 And Balak took Balaam to the head of the Peor, looking down on the face of the wasteland.

title: Numbers 23:29
content: 29 And Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me in this place seven altars and prepare for me in this place seven bulls and seven rams.”

title: Numbers 23:30
content: 30 And Balak did just as Balaam had said, and he offered up a bull and a ram on the altar.

title: Numbers 24:1
content: 1 And Balaam saw that it was good in the eyes of Yahweh to bless Israel, and he did not go as time by time to meet omens, and he set his face to the wilderness.

title: Numbers 24:2
content: 2 And Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel dwelling according to its tribes, and the Spirit of God was on him.

title: Numbers 24:3
content: 3 And he lifted up his discourse and said, “The declaration of Balaam the son of Beor, and the declaration of the man opened of eye,

title: Numbers 24:4
content: 4 the declaration of the hearer of the words of God, who sees the vision of the Almighty, falling down and opened of eyes:

title: Numbers 24:5
content: 5 How good are your tents, Jacob, your dwellings, Israel!

title: Numbers 24:6
content: 6 Like wadis they spread out, like gardens beside a river, like aloes Yahweh has planted, like cedars beside water.

title: Numbers 24:7
content: 7 Water will flow from his buckets, and his seed with much water. And his king will be higher than Agag, and his kingdom will lift itself up.

title: Numbers 24:8
content: 8 God is bringing him out from Egypt, like the horns of a wild ox for him. He will eat the nations, his enemies. And he will break their bones. And he will strike his arrows.

title: Numbers 24:9
content: 9 He crouched, he lay down like a lion, and like a lioness. Who will get him up? Those who bless you are blessed; and those who curse you are cursed.”

title: Numbers 24:10
content: 10 And the nose of Balak burned toward Balaam and he struck his palms, and Balak said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, and behold, you have repeatedly blessed these three times!

title: Numbers 24:11
content: 11 And now, flee for yourself to your place. I said I would honor you greatly, and behold, Yahweh has held you back from honor.”

title: Numbers 24:12
content: 12 And Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not also speak to the messengers that you sent to me, saying.

title: Numbers 24:13
content: 13 ‘If Balak gives to me his house full of silver and gold, I will not be able to go beyond the mouth of Yahweh to do good or evil from my heart; what Yahweh speaks, it I must speak?’

title: Numbers 24:14
content: 14 And now, behold I am about to go to my people. Come, I will advise you what this people will do to your people in the future days.”

title: Numbers 24:15
content: 15 And he lifted up his discourse and said, “The declaration of Balaam the son of Beor, and the declaration of the man opened of eye,

title: Numbers 24:16
content: 16 the declaration of the hearer of the words of God, and the knower of the knowledge of the Most High, he sees the vision of the Almighty, falling down and opened of eyes:

title: Numbers 24:17
content: 17 I will see him, but not now; I will look at him, but not near. A star has marched from Jacob, and a rod has risen from Israel, and he will strike the sides of Moab and destroy all the sons of Seth.

title: Numbers 24:18
content: 18 And Edom will become a possession, and Seir will become a possession, his enemies. And Israel will act strongly.

title: Numbers 24:19
content: 19 And he will rule from Jacob, and he will destroy the survivor from a city.”

title: Numbers 24:20
content: 20 And he saw Amalek and lifted up his discourse and said, “The first of the nations is Amalek, and his end will be up to destruction.”

title: Numbers 24:21
content: 21 And he saw the Kenite, and he lifted up his discourse and said, “Your dwelling is permanent, and your nest is set in the cliff.

title: Numbers 24:22
content: 22 But the Kenite will be for burning. Until when will Assyria take you captive?”

title: Numbers 24:23
content: 23 And he lifted up his discourse and said, “Woe! Who can live apart from God establishing him?

title: Numbers 24:24
content: 24 And ships will be from the hand of Kittim, and they will afflict Asshur and will afflict Eber, and he, too, will be up to destruction.”

title: Numbers 24:25
content: 25 And Balaam got up and went and returned to his place, and Balak also went on his way.

title: Numbers 25:1
content: 1 And Israel dwelled in Shittim, and the people began to prostitute themselves with the daughters of Moab,

title: Numbers 25:2
content: 2 and they called the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate, and they worshipped their gods.

title: Numbers 25:3
content: 3 And Israel bound himself to Baal of Peor. And the nose of Yahweh burned against Israel.

title: Numbers 25:4
content: 4 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Take all the heads of the people and hang them up before Yahweh in front of the sun, and the burning of the nose of Yahweh may turn back from Israel.”

title: Numbers 25:5
content: 5 And Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Slay a man his men, the ones who bound themselves to Baal of Peor.”

title: Numbers 25:6
content: 6 And behold, a man from the sons of Israel came and brought near to his brothers the Midianite woman, before the eyes of Moses and before the eyes of all the congregation of the sons of Israel. And they were weeping at the opening of the tent of meeting.

title: Numbers 25:7
content: 7 And Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw and rose up from the midst of the congregation, and took a spear in his hand.

title: Numbers 25:8
content: 8 And he came after the man of Israel into the domed tent, and he pierced the two of them, the man of Israel and the woman in her stomach. And the plague was stopped from on the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 25:9
content: 9 And the ones who died by the plague were 24, 000.

title: Numbers 25:10
content: 10 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 25:11
content: 11 “Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned my heat from on the sons of Israel by his being zealous with my zeal in the midst of them. And I will not make an end of the sons of Israel in my zeal.

title: Numbers 25:12
content: 12 Therefore say, ‘Behold, I am giving to him my covenant of peace.

title: Numbers 25:13
content: 13 And it will be a covenant of a priesthood of eternity for him and for his seed after him, because he was zealous for his God and he made atonement for the sons of Israel.’”

title: Numbers 25:14
content: 14 And the name of the man of Israel, the struck down one who was struck down with the Midianite woman, was Zimri the son of Salu, the leader of a house of a father of the Simeonites.

title: Numbers 25:15
content: 15 And the name of the woman, the struck down Midanite woman, was Kozbi the daughter of Zur, who was the head of a tribe of a house of a father in Midian.

title: Numbers 25:16
content: 16 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 25:17
content: 17 “Vex the Midianites and you shall strike them down.

title: Numbers 25:18
content: 18 For they were vexing you by their deceitfulness when they deceived you over the matter of Peor and over the matter of Kozbi the daughter of the leader of Midian, their sister, the one struck down on the plague day over the matter of Peor.”

title: Numbers 26:1
content: 1 And it happened after the plague that Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,

title: Numbers 26:2
content: 2 “Lift up the heads of all the congregation of the sons of Israel from a son of 20 years and upward according to the house of their fathers, all who go out to war in Israel.”

title: Numbers 26:3
content: 3 And Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab beside the Jordan at Jericho, saying,

title: Numbers 26:4
content: 4 “From a son of 20 years and upward, just as Yahweh commanded Moses and the sons of Israel, the ones who came out from the land of Egypt.”

title: Numbers 26:5
content: 5 Reuben was the firstborn of Israel. The sons of Reuben: Hanok, the clan of the Hanokite; of Pallu, the clan of the Palluite;

title: Numbers 26:6
content: 6 of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronite; of Karmi, the clan of the Karmite.

title: Numbers 26:7
content: 7 These were the clans of the Reubenite. And their counted ones were 43, 730.

title: Numbers 26:8
content: 8 And the son of Pallu was Eliab.

title: Numbers 26:9
content: 9 And the sons of Eliab were Nemuel and Dathan and Abiram. This is Dathan and Abiram, the called ones of the congregation, who rebelled against Moses and against Aaron with the congregation of Korah when they rebelled against Yahweh.

title: Numbers 26:10
content: 10 And the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them and Korah when the congregation died, when the fire ate 250 men, and they became a sign.

title: Numbers 26:11
content: 11 And the sons of Korah did not die.

title: Numbers 26:12
content: 12 The sons of Simeon according to their clans: of Nemuel, the clan of the Nemuelite; of Jamin, the clan of the Jaminite; of Jakin, the clan of the Jakinite;

title: Numbers 26:13
content: 13 of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahite; of Shaul, the clan of the Shaulite.

title: Numbers 26:14
content: 14 These were the clans of the Simeonite, 22, 200.

title: Numbers 26:15
content: 15 The sons of Gad according to their clans: of Zephon, the clan of the Zephonite; of Haggi, the clan of the Haggite; of Shuni, the clan of the Shunite;

title: Numbers 26:16
content: 16 of Ozni, the clan of the Oznite; of Eri, the clan of the Erite;

title: Numbers 26:17
content: 17 of Arod, the clan of the Arodite; of Areli, the clan of the Arelite.

title: Numbers 26:18
content: 18 These were the clans of the sons of Gad according to their counted ones, 40, 500.

title: Numbers 26:19
content: 19 The sons of Judah were Er and Onan, and Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.

title: Numbers 26:20
content: 20 And the sons of Judah according to their clans were: of Shelah, the clan of the Shelanite; of Perez, the clan of the Perezite; of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahite.

title: Numbers 26:21
content: 21 And the sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronite; of Hamul, the clan of the Hamulite.

title: Numbers 26:22
content: 22 These were the clans of Judah according to their counted ones, 76, 500.

title: Numbers 26:23
content: 23 The sons of Issachar according to their clans: Tola, the clan of the Tolaite; of Puah, the clan of the Puite;

title: Numbers 26:24
content: 24 of Jashub, the clan of the Jashubite; of Shimron, the clan of the Shimronite.

title: Numbers 26:25
content: 25 These were the clans of Issachar according to their counted ones, 64, 300.

title: Numbers 26:26
content: 26 The sons of Zebulun according to their clans: of Sered, the clan of the Seredite; of Elon, the clan of the Elonite; of Jahleel, the clan of the Jahleelite.

title: Numbers 26:27
content: 27 These were the clans of the Zebulunite according to their counted ones, 60, 500.

title: Numbers 26:28
content: 28 The sons of Joseph according to their clans were Manasseh and Ephraim.

title: Numbers 26:29
content: 29 The sons of Manasseh: of Makir, the clan of the Makirite (and Makir fathered Gilead); of Gilead, the clan of the Gileadite.

title: Numbers 26:30
content: 30 These were the sons of Gilead: Iezer, the clan of the Iezerite; of Helek, the clan of the Helekite;

title: Numbers 26:31
content: 31 and Asriel, the clan of the Asrielite; and Shechem, the clan of the Shechemite;

title: Numbers 26:32
content: 32 and Shemida, the clan of the Shemidaite; and Hepher, the clan of the Hepherite.

title: Numbers 26:33
content: 33 And there were no sons for Zelophehad the son of Hepher, but daughters. And the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milkah, and Tirzah.

title: Numbers 26:34
content: 34 These were the clans of Manasseh and their counted ones, 52, 700.

title: Numbers 26:35
content: 35 These were the sons of Ephraim according to their clans: of Shuthelah, the clan of the Shuthelahite; of Beker, the clan of the Bekerite; of Tahan, the clan of the Tahanite.

title: Numbers 26:36
content: 36 And these were the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the clan of the Eranite.

title: Numbers 26:37
content: 37 These were the clans of the sons of Ephraim according to their counted ones, 32, 500. These were the sons of Joseph according to their clans.

title: Numbers 26:38
content: 38 The sons of Benjamin according to their clans: of Bela, the clan of the Belaite; of Ashbel, the clan of the Ashbelite; of Ahiram, the clan of the Ahiramite;

title: Numbers 26:39
content: 39 of Shephupham, the clan of the Shuphamite; of Hupham, the clan of the Huphamite.

title: Numbers 26:40
content: 40 And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: the clan of the Ardite; of Naaman, the clan of the Naamite.

title: Numbers 26:41
content: 41 These were the sons of Benjamin according to their clans. And their counted ones were 45, 600.

title: Numbers 26:42
content: 42 These were the sons of Dan according to their clans: of Shuham, the clan of the Shuhamite. These were the clans of Dan according to their clans.

title: Numbers 26:43
content: 43 All the clans of the Shuhamite according to their counted ones were 64, 400.

title: Numbers 26:44
content: 44 The sons of Asher according to their clans: of Imnah, the clan of the Imnite; of Ishvi, the clan of the Ishvite; of Beriah, the clan of the Beriite.

title: Numbers 26:45
content: 45 The sons of Beriah: of Heber, the clan of the Heberite; of Malkiel, the clan of the Malkielite.

title: Numbers 26:46
content: 46 And the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.

title: Numbers 26:47
content: 47 These were the clans of the sons of Asher according to their counted ones, 53, 400.

title: Numbers 26:48
content: 48 The sons of Naphtali according to their clans: of Jahzeel, the clan of the Jahzeelite; of Guni, the clan of the Gunite;

title: Numbers 26:49
content: 49 of Jezer, the clan of the Jezerite; of Shillem, the clan of the Shillemite.

title: Numbers 26:50
content: 50 These were the clans of Naphtali according to their clans. And their counted ones were 45, 400.

title: Numbers 26:51
content: 51 These were the counted ones of the sons of Israel: 601, 730.

title: Numbers 26:52
content: 52 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 26:53
content: 53 “The land shall be apportioned to these ones as an inheritance by the number of the names.

title: Numbers 26:54
content: 54 To the numerous you shall increase his inheritance, and to the small you shall lessen his inheritance. His inheritance shall be given, a man according to the mouth of his counted ones.

title: Numbers 26:55
content: 55 Surely the land shall be apportioned by lots. They shall inherit according to the names of the tribes of their fathers.

title: Numbers 26:56
content: 56 His inheritance shall be apportioned in accordance with the mouth of the lot, between the numerous and the small.”

title: Numbers 26:57
content: 57 And these were the counted ones of the Levite according to their clans: of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonite; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathite; of Merari, the clan of the Merarite.

title: Numbers 26:58
content: 58 These were the clans of the Levite: the clan of the Libnite, the clan of the Hebronite, the clan of the Mahlite, the clan of the Mushite, the clan of the Korahite. And Kohath fathered Amram.

title: Numbers 26:59
content: 59 And the name of the wife of Amram was Jochebed, a daughter of Levi, she who was born to Levi in Egypt. And she bore to Amram Aaron and Moses and Miriam their sister.

title: Numbers 26:60
content: 60 And to Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

title: Numbers 26:61
content: 61 And Nadab and Abihu died when they offered unfamiliar fire before the face of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 26:62
content: 62 And their counted ones were 23, 000, every male from a son of a month and upward. But they were not counted in the midst of the sons of Israel because an inheritance in the midst of the sons of Israel was not given to them.

title: Numbers 26:63
content: 63 These are the counted ones of Moses and Eleazar the priest when they counted the sons of Israel in the plains of Moab beside the Jordan at Jericho.

title: Numbers 26:64
content: 64 And among these there was not a man from the counted ones of Moses and Aaron the priest when they counted the sons of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.

title: Numbers 26:65
content: 65 For Yahweh had said to them, “You shall surely die in the wilderness and a man shall not remain from them, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.”

title: Numbers 27:1
content: 1 And the daughters of Zelophehad the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir the son of Manasseh, of the clans of Manasseh the son of Joseph came near. And these were the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah and Hoglah and Milkah and Tirzah.

title: Numbers 27:2
content: 2 And they stood before the face of Moses and before the face of Eleazar the priest and before the face of the leaders and all the congregation at the opening of the tent of meeting, saying,

title: Numbers 27:3
content: 3 “Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not in the midst of the congregation who assembled against Yahweh with the congregation of Korah, but he died in his sin, and there were no sons for him.

title: Numbers 27:4
content: 4 Why should the name of our father be withdrawn from the midst of his clan because there is no son for him? Give to us a possession in the midst of the brothers of our father.”

title: Numbers 27:5
content: 5 And Moses brought near their case before the face of Yahweh.

title: Numbers 27:6
content: 6 And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

title: Numbers 27:7
content: 7 “The daughters of Zelophehad are speaking rightly. You shall certainly give to them the possession of an inheritance in the midst of the brothers of their father, and you shall cause the inheritance of their father to pass over to them.

title: Numbers 27:8
content: 8 And you shall speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘If a man dies and there is no son for him, then you shall cause his inheritance to pass over to his daughter.

title: Numbers 27:9
content: 9 And if there is no daughter for him, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.

title: Numbers 27:10
content: 10 And if there are no brothers for him, then you shall give his inheritance to the brothers of his father.

title: Numbers 27:11
content: 11 And if there are no brothers for his father, then you shall give his inheritance to his blood-relative, the nearest to him from his clan, and he shall take possession of it. And it shall be for the sons of Israel as a statute of judgment, just as Yahweh has commanded Moses.’”

title: Numbers 27:12
content: 12 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Go up to this mountain of Abarim, and see the land that I have given to the sons of Israel.

title: Numbers 27:13
content: 13 And you shall see it and be gathered to your people, also you, just as Aaron your brother was gathered,

title: Numbers 27:14
content: 14 because in the wilderness of Zin, in the quarrel of the congregation, you rebelled against my mouth to regard me as holy at the waters before their eyes.” These are the waters of Meribah Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.

title: Numbers 27:15
content: 15 And Moses spoke to Yahweh, saying,

title: Numbers 27:16
content: 16 “May Yahweh, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the congregation

title: Numbers 27:17
content: 17 who will go out before the face of them and who will come before the face of them, and who will take them out and who will bring them in, and the congregation of Yahweh will not be like sheep that have no shepherd for them.”

title: Numbers 27:18
content: 18 And Yahweh said to Moses, “Take for yourself Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is a spirit, and lay your hand on him.

title: Numbers 27:19
content: 19 And you shall stand him before the face of Eleazar the priest and before the face of all the congregation, and you shall command him before their eyes.

title: Numbers 27:20
content: 20 And you shall give some of your authority on him, so that all the congregation of the sons of Israel will hear.
